IXVW63ERk2np3eyUS92OlQ.text: Had Spak Bros for the first time in the form of a Philly Cheese Steak. It was awesome because a 6 inch was totally filling and delicious. The menu accommodated the needs of my vegan friends who raved about the Seitan thingy. What impressed me most about my meal was the super fresh and flavorful bread that was used in my sub. I could have had more veggies on my sammie but I'm sure I'm an outlier in that respect. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to accommodate eaters with special dietary needs.

s9HWXBvUBho0iAm0D3apAQ.text: Great hogie sandwich thing. BBQ grilled chicken. Bread was to die for.  Place is a dive but perfect. Awesome shitty pinball to play while you wait.

dP--0NZt-58TThe4lHLQaA.text: My go-to for pizza. It's always delicious and there are a good selection of toppings. They also have bottles of Boylan's soda, which is a plus. You should probably order pizza with bacon, pineapple, tomato, and spinach. Why not, since the 4th topping is free? You won't regret it. There are also lots of great vegan options.

SAj-VV7SCdfVPikdGNCe9g.text: One of the only places around Pittsburgh to serve jumbo wings DAILY!  These wings are very tasty, crispy and not soggy.  Sandwiches are full of whatever you order and the cooks, crew there are awesome. Turning into one of my favorite go to places on any day of the week.

AueQHUy34bfRgtCx9wR-Pg.text: A busy, small and take-out oriented pizza parlor with many inventive non-pizza menu items.  This, my first visit came around lunch time and I tried a 'seitan steak' sub.  There are many veg-friendly options, notably those with seitan (wheat gluten) substituted for meat.  Grilled fresh with delicious cheese, bread and veggies.  I saw a finished pizza come out of the oven, it was 10 feet away and from then I knew I was coming back for another tasting.

eRkGmKE8gTWedoZwMMcRsA.text: I absolutely love this place. Their pizza is really good and they have a lot of vegan options. The only thing is the second time I went here the crust was kind of soggy, but the first time the pizza was perfect. Also, their seitan wings are tasty and they have really good vegan ranch. Even the salads are pretty good. There isn't much seating, its more of a take out pizza place. I just wish the construction on the main street was finished, which makes it more difficult to get there. I definitely recommend going!

s1bS39jOzMTDbMO17Z_Uow.text: Finding good-tasting vegetarian or vegan choices in and around the rust belt area is tough, but Spak's is a savior! Pizza with Veggie pepperoni and Veggie cheese was actually pretty good. You're not going to trick your carnivore friends that is as good as a regular pizza but it's got a good flavor, dough is good, too. The Seiten buffalo wings were insanely good! I couldn't believe hiw much flavor they had and the texture was close to an actual buffalo wing! I live about 40 minutes away but think about driving across town almost everyday just for the wings. Is mark this place as a favorite of your looking for vegetarian or vegan options in the Pittsburgh area!

iaHE5LBhV9sktt35nfwFpQ.text: Simple place, not much seating, but cool atmosphere. When I went, there weren't enough seats for us but we wanted to take it home anyway. I wish they delivered! Pizza is really good, the crust is flavorful and the toppings are good quality. The cheesesteak sandwich was okay, but not great (the meat was reminiscent of Steak-ems). I will definitely hit them up again for pizza and if they delivered I would probably order all the time.

S8dOOhmo8b0VbdVB0AYTCw.text: I eat meat, but I'm friends with a lot of vegans.   Vegan food: The pizza here is terrible and it tastes like cardboard and wax.  The wings are dried out. Nothing jumps out at me.  It's all pretty bland.  I've had their non vegan wraps/sandwiches as well.  Terrible.  Terrible.

q35awQFmuZerF9TiXBTp0w.text: Two pizza experiences with Spak in one week should tell you something. Yes, we moved homes this week (so that was a big factor in the frequency) BUT their pizza IS AMAZING. And their seitan wings. But really - vegan pizza? Having been vegan greater than 2.5 years, I have not had pizza (besides something frozen :/ ) that entire time. And I was so happy to have my first pizza experience with Spak. Great food, fresh ingredients, and a crispy crust. Thank you, Spak brothers, for the divine experience.

6Un-bkWaIzmvowufnmGLTw.text: OOMMMGGG. I am such a pizza lover and this place makes me SOOO happy!! I had no idea it was even there until I drove by one day and went in for the simple reason that I wanted pizza and there was a cute boy standing out front. Everyone is really nice and I've tried pick up now and it only takes about 20 minutes. The pizza is so good. I'm a single girl and it takes me a few days to eat a pie and this is actually really great heated up the next day. I'm always sad when I'm finished with my pizza. I give it an A+. Check it out!

VgGR0Y4CPJqTyf8W-my4Cw.text: This is my new favorite pizza place near the East End. They don't deliver, but it's worth the drive to pick up. Don't be deterred from the stupid construction on Penn. They have a parking lot on the side of the building that is easy enough to get to. We ordered a couple of pizzas, and they were ready 25 minutes later. Crust was great. Sauce is legit, and the ingredients fresh. Service and price is good, too.

UN67IG2_RmoKLANrjQ6r-w.text: Huge hits and huge misses at Spak Brothers.  Sometimes you can get the best sandwich of your life and sometimes it is simply awful.  Sometimes the bread is perfect, crusty on the outside and chewy on the inside.  Sometimes the sauce is amazing tasty and not too greasy.  Sometimes not.  The hits make the misses somewhat worth it though.  Whatever you do order before hand because the wait can be quite something.  The service is usually pretty indifferent.  The decor is pretty awful as well.  I do like the fact that you can play pinball there though.

1a8vvl5GXYdvvbCjOmYisg.text: Hail seitan!!! Spak Brothers should be listed as a Pittsburgh cultural heritage site. Sure, it may not be the most conventional pie places, but it is surely the most diverse.   I first want to mention their seitan. For vegheads, this place has one of the best seitans that I have ever experienced. The rule of thumb is to try their seitan melts, especially with vegan cheese, it is heaven in a hoagie. Their vegan pies also does some justice but I think for all you cheese lovers, you might need to keep an open mind.  As for non-veg stuff. They provide. They rock some mad skills with their non-hippyified pies too and wings... check.   Listen, if you want the boring-as-hell pizzas then sure, there are a million joints out there. However, if you want an experience that excites each and every one of your tastebud, look no further.

cV5i_VYSxDqdYwN3TZhdkw.text: I only give 5-star reviews very rarely.  Spak consistently has *excellent* pizza. Obviously good ingredients, prepared carefully and well, served hot, short(ish) wait times. My usual pizza order is a slice with vegetarian sausage. $3. Delicious and easily the best I've had in Pittsburgh.  The pizza alone would make them one of my favorite places to eat in town, but it's the amazing seitan sandwiches that propel this place into one-of-a-kind territory. I've never had seitan like this anywhere else. It's tender, just the right amount of chewy, flavorful, delicious, and just great. I don't know anywhere else in America you can get a 6" sandwich for $5 that is this good. Really! You can't go wrong ordering a seitan sandwich--choose whichever suits your fancy and you won't be disappointed.  Also--and this is just icing on the cake--the vibe is very cool. Friendly counter staff, super unpredictable variety of music playing, interesting local art on the walls, and two nineties-vintage pinball machines to while away the minutes as your food is made to order.  Spak is a fantastic neighborhood joint with really, really good food at cheap prices. Try the seitan.

FdUThhF_NeScT5RPA__jKw.text: I absolutely love this place for their vegan options! Their pizza is absolutely amazing as well as their wings. The sandwiches are the best though. A classic Pittsburgh sandwich veganized! This is my favorite place to eat at in Pittsburgh. The staff is always friendly and nice inside. It has a nice artsy feel to it as well. I would highly recommend grabbing some vegan grub here. Thanks for offering alternative options!

uXGk_fLN3KzLUF2_AVqx5Q.text: My first experience at Spak was meh, but I think that might have been half my fault. Came here for a late night pizza with mushroom and pepperoni, to support the business (there had been a break in earlier in the week). Had some trouble getting through on the phone, but once I did there was a 25 minute wait - busy Saturday night. Had I known there were pinball machines in the waiting area, I might have hung out a while. Pizza was average to below-average, with a thick, doughy crust that was a lot to chew through. Would be willing to try a thinner crust or more creative pizza.

AsVhHrNDh-kmheVOuAA4LQ.text: Their pizza is out of this world and their hoagie are incredible. Having them down the street always has its up sides....

F_bbqw7zA_SHHIjkGHi6OQ.text: My favorite seitan wings in the city. The sauces are perfect and enough so that they aren't too dry. The seitan cheesesteak comes pretty close to the real thing!

7fLnGM5sWrRSwaeA-WFAAg.text: Spak is my favorite place in the city to get pizza. Their food is consistently delicious!  Get the steak sandwich with egg on it. Amazing!!

fCBIPvLnFtP_2fnEDdnarQ.text: This place sure is popular! Perhaps almost a little too popular.   My biggest gripe with this place is how difficult it can be to order/pickup food. I've been here during the Garfield art crawl and it is PACKED, but that is to be expected.  What surprised me is how long you have to wait even on a typical weekday. My husband made the mistake of popping in after work to pick up a pizza and a hoagie without calling ahead.  Well, they were out of hoagies and the pizza took 45 minutes IN HOUSE. I feel like your typical greasy pizza place can get your pizza done in about 15. We learned our lesson and try to call ahead of time, but it's pretty common to either have the phone ring and ring, or someone pick up and put you on hold for five or even ten minutes.   Despite how popular this place is, I'm not actually all that crazy about the pizza. The sauce is a little on the sweet side for me, and I typically go for a thinner crust. It is a completely acceptable pizza- I'd certainly choose this over Domino's or something- but not the best I've had.  Their Italian hoagies ARE killer, tho and that's why keep going back- great quality meat, delicious bread.

Qlfe2So-_CT49oUcPy-N8w.text: Getting food from here is an mixed bag so I'm going to do a pro/con list, but I've had a few bad experiences in a row which has prompted me to write this review.  First, the pros.  -The pizza crust and ingredients are some of the best I've had from a take-out pizza place. -The wings are quite good and the blue cheese that comes with is delicious. -The sandwiches that I've tried are actually good, unlike the afterthought sandwiches you get from most pizza places.  Now, the cons.  -Recently they screwed up one of our orders, which is a mistake that generally wouldn't bother me too much except for the fact that they gave my girlfriend attitude when she went back in to get the correct food remade.  This was after we had to wait much longer than their estimated pickup time to receive the incorrect food. -Their ability to answer the phone in a timely manner is seriously lacking.  The last two times we've called we sat on the phone for several minutes or more, and nobody ever picked up the phone, even to ask us to please hold.  The appeal of ordering pizza is fast service and a fast meal, so sitting on hold without ever speaking to a person (even to acknowledge that they got our call) is really annoying.

7NKL7jNlzvPvtLP2dxoZ4Q.text: I have severe mixed feelings about this place. It's like your racist aunt that makes really good food so you put up with her shit to get the yum yums. The pizza is great. They have daiya cheese and lots of toppings to choose from. They use an old school brick oven which takes longer but makes better pizza. Service is shady. Takes forever. Definitely call ahead for pickup and then arrive 20 minutes after the estimated time they gave you. There isn't really a dine in option, just 5 bar stools, so plan to get it to go. They curse in front of kids so if that bothers you beware.

eGdxVhcZTDHfJuZRSJpuHA.text: The pizza was very good and so were the buffalo wings! Took a long time to get the food, but the quality is there

QkzW4Zia0hgdFDN1nNBycg.text: I ordered a steak sandwich and told the cashier I would like the bread not to be toasted as well as no veggies. Either the cashier didn't listen to a word I said or the cook didn't bother to see if there were modifications. It came out wrong and I didn't notice until I got home and tried to eat it. It was taken back and remade, the remake was terrible and dry with barely any cheese or meat for what was a 13 dollar sandwich. I don't recommend this place to anyone.

liOMD9IUlp0lBnnfbyQBqg.text: I have to admit I was disappointed.   First, if you've read any other reviews, you know the ordering process is difficult bordering on ridiculous. It's kind of like dog years...for every one minute you may wait to order at a normal pizza place, you will wait seven minutes at Spak Brothers. Alas, the ordering Gods smiled upon me and I only had to wait 8 minutes to place my order (on my third try). I went with a medium pizza- half pepperoni, half sausage- and the seitan wings with the honey mustard sauce. The honey mustard sauce had a little kick to it, which I wasn't expecting, but rather enjoyed. The seitan though...It was so chewy! Why? Why is it so chewy??? It was like eating a bike tire bathed in a delicious sauce. Everyone raves about these things...I've had better seitan from Whole Foods! I feel like I have to try it again just to see if it's always like that, or if it was just a bad batch.  The pizza was decent; the BF and I both liked the sauce. Other than that, there was nothing so amazing about it that I would go out of my way to get it. We plan to try it once more, but I am not holding my breath that the Brothers will redeem themselves.

NMUtfCOSfxB83gzoMIjTqw.text: Listen, almost two years later and this is my favorite spot in the city. My husband and I have it every Tuesday it's our tradition now, and every time is better than the last. I love you spak brothers. Don't ever leave me

oI5OzlZLox5Z3mzEWUZw4A.text: Called repeatedly yesterday to place an order around 8 PM. No one answered the phone, and there was no recording to communicate I was being put on hold. The star is because I liked listening to the thoughtfully curated vintage indie rock their phone line played to me instead of forcing me to listen to endless ringing.  Patronizing hipster "businesses" can be such an emotional roller coaster - every oz. of the energy goes to managing their online presence & various other aspects of an overall cooler-than-you image - then when it's time to deliver the service, there's just nothing left, & we're all expected to put up with "the customer's always a pain in our supercool asses" attitude.

pkOjnMIT8_duPSJWDe4Z6w.text: The food and pizza are very good. Most of all the salads. I really love the bread they use for the sandwiches. It's that big soft bun that just soaks up the sauce or what ever you have on it. The salads are never skimpy and full of flavor. I really love the ranch they use.  It's a place you always have to order way ahead of time because it's almost never ready when they say it is. Now you could say it's because they are busy and yes most of the time they are but when they say 20min they mean 35 or 40. But you don't want to show up late because if your food is ready you don't want it getting cold. I would give this place a 5 or 4 and of ordered more from them if they did not have that issue. It's just this issue. But the food is so good I went back so its worth a shot. Just remember the times issue when you order.

lkr5_xiedrLzy3s5aaW28Q.text: Ohhh Spakky Spak Spak.  I heart you.  You know my comfort food needs, especially as an eater of vegetarian foods.    These guys are Masters of Seitan; in particular, the seitan wings and seitan cheesesteak are my absolute favorites.  I am assured the meat and vegan options are awesome too. All the sandwiches are on a delicious, crusty bread, and I personally am more blown away by their sandwiches than pizza, which is tasty and has lots of fun topping choices but is not the absolute best in  the city (that honor, in my estimation, is owned by Mineo's).  Expect to wait on the phone for awhile on hold at peak times.

2E-v2hciHdM1qjI4XUPVlQ.text: I know the seitan wings and vegan pizzas and hoagies are the stars of the show here, but I just went with a pizza. I was visiting town and a friend recommended the place immediately when I asked if she had a suggested for lunch. I ordered a pepperoni and onion pizza and sat down and waited. It was ready in about 15 minutes, and it was delightful. The crust was an ideal thickness and texture, and the cheese was melty and gooey and delicious. I'll definitely come back for a hoagie next time I'm in Pittsburgh.

uvchf5Yfs_yQGkpcV0BKpw.text: I've been wanting to try Spak Brother for awhile now. From co-workers raving about it to the artistic exterior to the building, I wanted to see what the hoopla was all about. I was in Bloomfield for work so I decided to stop by and grab a sandwich.   The inside is nothing to brag about. It's not somewhere I'd be comfortable eating inside at, but I don't think they market it that way so I can't really take points off because of that. There are a few places to sit and a pinball table, but nothing substantial.   The menu is decent sized. All the basics and nothing too too fancy. I went with the grilled chicken breast hoagie with lettuce, tomato, cheese and ranch dressing. It took about 15-20 minutes to make, but it was well worth the wait! Everything was so fresh and tasty. It practically melted in my mouth. The best part was the ranch dressing. It was so creamy and full of flavor. I am obsessed with homemade ranch sauces and this was one of the best I've ever tasted. The sandwich (half) was $6 including tax and I think it was reasonably priced. Most full sandwiches went between $8-$9.   I'm excited to go back and try some more options on the menu! Nothing better than supporting local business, especially those on Penn Avenue during all of this messy construction!

Drxb1oqkXwDDyUKZFXFOnw.text: The wait is VERY long on a Friday or Saturday night. Their pizza is tasty and always fresh - chewy crust, sweet/savory sauce, and lots of delicious gooey cheese. The slices are pretty huge, and they offer many tasty topping options. They have a seriously hipster vibe, and I definitely did not feel that I was cool enough to get my pizza at this place. Would I return? Possibly. However, there are MANY other pizza places locally that are faster with service, offer comparable pizza, and that are more laid back in atmosphere.

S7v1IbQXI9TRum1MHo95qw.text: Service was really great, I loved that there were vegan options for me. Location was really nice too, close to a lot of things I was doing in the area!

HgT7j9RTtLyauBlRmNuG1w.text: I have ordered from here since my original review and the price was more reasonable which leads me to believe there may have been a mistake on the cost initially. Still a little pricy but will still order from here once in a while as the food is usually good.

xYKc2nFxPUdxTTGA8OOQNw.text: Thrilled whenever I journey to Pittsburgh on business because I get to pick up an Italian Hoagie from Spak Brothers. Absolutely delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Z1iQETlRvCGtNVtYMiMDiA.text: THE place to get pizza in Pittsburgh. Brick oven ZA with super fresh ingredients! Something for everyone, vegan and vegetarian options. Plus there's pinball!!Super nice staff. Seriously, just go here. It's a game changer.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. GOOD ASS PIZZA!!!!

zGblYYFjrQQWQ0V3yvxp5w.text: Ordered their blue steak sandwich. Really tasty bread and the right combo to not be just a Philly cheesesteak.

6fDyrlFXSgUbBgHxyO_Hag.text: Delicious thin-crust pizza, solid wings, and great hoagies...what more could you want? Less popularity! I love that PGH loves this place, but I will attach some serious caveats if you're trying to order at peak demand hours--order well ahead by phone, and keep calling back until you get someone. I once drove the 15 minutes to the shop before I got through via phone, and then I was warned off wings due to the time involved (understandable--freshly cooked is always nice). So be VERY prepared to wait, or call at least 90 minutes before you want your food!  Spak is also a short walk from Friendship Parklet if you are here during better weather and want some sunshine with your meal.

KWveyvkJIT2wNsNOrFGwaA.text: Praise the Spak. They just went out of their way to bake us an entire second pizza, because they felt self-conscious and thought they burned the first one. (They didn't.) both pizzas were amazing. so far above and beyond - great place

nCcI93e_AVKqY7_YwJRf3g.text: Love that they have a large vegan offering. Their vegan pizza was good, what you'd expect for it. I think they used daiya cheese. I got the white pizza and instead of ricotta got the vegan cheese - no up change which is nice. I think $1.50 for toppings is very pricey. Esp if you are just getting a small pizza. I added basil to mine and there were only tiny little slivers of it... def not worth $1.50. I'd give 5 stars if you could get a cheaper veggie pizza. Inside is small and they don't deliver so really just good for takeout. Would come back.

WRPxxA6ItG1KAQ67NOYx9w.text: I ordered 4 slices of pizza. All slices were dry, burnt, toppings were thrown on top along with new cheese to cover the old cheese. Spaks may have lost their touch or need different employees. Never should anyone employed by spaks should ever sell old pizza to anyone especially with the great reputation that they have had for years.

Ruku7ZHwm22w9rfzJsW3Pg.text: Long time Garfield resident and I dont know where my family & friends would be if we couldnt order Spaks a few times a month. Favorite pizza & greek salad with chicken is the best go to.

umicYuJJB2pMLfP4Na_y0Q.text: Simply the best seitan cheesesteaks ever. I love every single thing on the menu, but don't expect anything healthy. This is a place for when you just want straight up the best vegan junk food in Pittsburgh. The steaks, the wings, and the seitan salad are all freaking amazing.

SMu2NgoUHWTraefLX57uEg.text: I don't have a place I drop in as regularly as I do Spak - I love absolutely everything about it. Seitan wings are the best, period - the texture is better than any other seitan I've had, and they taste delicious. Pizza - fantastic, even the soy cheese, which is not always great on pizzas. Salads are amazing, and the hoagies too. GO GET FOOD HERE.  Only thing I can think of in the negative - do some sort of delivery. It's ridiculous they don't do it themselves, or sign up with a third party delivery. Also, there is never enough ranch or celery with the wings no matter how often I ask for some extra... a forgivable offense, but quit skimping on celery!

14uHVTQYGkFxVTfXmh3BSg.text: I was in the area for a concert and my friends and me decided on this little place for dinner. We were all very satisfied with our meals.  I got garlic parmesan wings. I've had a lot of garlic wings in my day and they were definitely some of the best I've ever had, I definitely recommend those.   One of my friends got a buffalo chicken sandwich and I commented on how delicious it looked , so she offered me a bite and it sure was!!   I will be back!!

R2uLxBq-M12Fh9G1hv0qkQ.text: I dream of Spak Brother's now that I'm no longer living in Pittsburgh. They have the best veggie hoagies that are craveworthy by non-vegetarians like me.

b9r0LX09XpYmdHITS6C_dw.text: Some certainties exist in life - death and taxes, for example. I'd dare say another one is don't show up early or even on time to pick up takeout from Spak Brothers because it won't be ready (happened to me before). Yet another might be to plan on being put on hold for at least 5 minutes when ordering from Spak (today and I gave up). Whenever it's easier to get ahold of my loan refinancing bank than a local pizzeria there are problems.   Anyway, the time I actually did place and successfully pick up a pizza the experience was quite underwhelming. The pizza was surprisingly thin, and while I don't have any particular problem with thin pizza I do when it is soggy and flaccid. It might have been undercooked. At least it wasn't too expensive.  I'd be willing to try Spak again (I did try today), but they really got to work on the whole communication thing.

1AdzTn3n8ROxuX2MXb4dpw.text: Man do I love Spak Brothers!  I'm looking for an apartment and I am honestly, truly checking the distance from potential apartments to Spak Brothers bc that is a selling point for me.  I live in the S Hills now so my life has been sadly void of Spak.  I love everything about their pizza.  I'm not a vegetarian, but I can't  get enough of hteir Seitan wings.  Its cheap.  Its delicious.  I'm on a diet but I'll get fatter for Spak Brothers.

fdILFjVOYI-fT2bQ-qDGwg.text: We really enjoyed our experience. There is not much seating inside but people come and go quickly so we had no trouble sitting for a couple slices.   It took about 25 minutes for a small pizza on a busy Friday night. Half pineapple half pepperoni.   Plenty of parking. Glass soda bottles. Tons of topping options. Hipster atmosphere. They recycle.   We went because we heard they were robbed recently and wanted to support the business while they recover. Best of luck! Thanks for the great pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

N7_Zk34ONrw0UudfAPGhIw.text: The people who work here can be kind of dicks, but the pizza and sandwiches are great.   Their vegan cheese is pea-based, super tasty, but it does have a sort of glue-like texture. Their seitan cheese steaks (which can be made vegan) are really fantastic though: extremely satisfying, gooey, salty goodness. Also a good spot to find flyers for upcoming local shows.

gYGA8to92aRGgD8gHg6thA.text: Loved this place, came religiously. Was excited to bring out of town family next month just so they can taste the vegan sandwich but with the nearly 5 dollar increase for a whole sub I don't plan to return again. Add to that they were empty so I'm guessing the usual crowd feels the same way. Seems like different people working there too.

HlSV49_3w54tuyT7VE8VwQ.text: Used to have a dope Pittsburgh steak sandwich for an awesome price.... then they increased their prices by like 40%. For me, it's hard justifying paying 40% more for the same exact product.... and still the same 25+ minute wait. Yes, it's an awesome sandwich.... but it's the principle. Please bring back the old prices, Spak. :(

UCPxw476_cw-OhYQWTGXvg.text: We go to Spak all the time and their food has always been great. They have many good vegan options and all of them are tasty. Their vegan pizza is way above any other similar offerings in the east end.  They would have gotten 5 stars two weeks ago. Unfortunately their prices have gone WAY up, maybe for 2017? We order the same set of items almost every time and the total went up 53% from the last time we ordered there! I was shocked. There's no way we'll order from there as much as we used to (I'd say twice a month). It really seems like a boneheaded decision to raise it so much so quickly.

XizSIjg2CZsAhhjfQfky5Q.text: Went back against what the gods had prescribed.  I thought maybe these people had reorganized and would function as reasonable human beings since they came to their senses, somewhat, regarding their egregious price hike.  No fucking dice.    We were told 25 minutes and when we got to the shop, I stood around like a mod for an additional 25 minutes.  The seitan pittsburgh cheese steak was again not prepared as advertised.  No hot peppers, no egg, perhaps two lonely fries.  I'm officially done.  Cross another Yinzer paradise off the list.

xmKyQATPzO9np71IeJ4uOg.text: Spak makes me wish that I lived in PGH.  I was in visiting recently and was taken here by a fellow vegan that swore they had the best vegan cheese steaks and wings.  They were so right!  I will definitely be back every time that I'm in town.

KVFStlEcL1Bq_jm7SzuCfQ.text: Top-quality pizza? Not in my book. This pie does, however, taste identical to the sludgy squares passing for pizza that you'd find in a typical PA public high school cafeteria. I used to live less than 6 city blocks from this place and it was open during Penn Ave. First Fridays, so I ate here on occasion. And after the first bite, I figured out why it is such a success. It takes people here back to their childhoods, and such nostalgia is, for whatever reason, the barometer of "tasty" when it comes to pizza and other convenience foods in Pittsburgh.   As a former longtime resident of the Steel City, I get it. The economy is always tough, salaries are rudely low, Jeffy Romoff owns most everything (aside from whatever the banks sucked up, while you, the taxpayer, has the honor of footing the bill), and in most neighborhoods, being a homeowner entails feigning the requisite sense of deep delight at your weekly Saturday sessions spent giving the lawn a buzz cut that any military officer would salute. Those pressures can add up, kindling fond memories for the institutional government lunches you ate every weekday between September and early June before you turned 18 and were on your own. Simply put, Spak's takes you back to a simpler time, with pricing to match.   But Pittsburgh was never simple for me -- living at a subsistence level ain't fun after a while -- so when my spouse and I skip home cooking for fast casual pizza, I want to TASTE the flavors. I'm afraid I just wasn't enchanted with the offerings at Spak's. It's not their fault, either. They're simply catering to the market, and they know it well. Many longtime Pittsburghers have learned to expect very little (o hai!), so when a restaurant serves anything vegetarian at all, it instantly becomes a hit. But I want more. I want food that is marginally better than what you'll find at a typical Rust Belt public high school. If you do too, this is not the type of pizza parlor you'll want to spend your scarce free time visiting.

09ZLScPn0XQpeiv6MxT7kg.text: This is basically a take out pizza joint.  It has a hip vibe.  There are two pinball machines in the place.  The staff is very friendly.   The pizza is quite good.  The thin crust is quite good.  The sauce was just right.  There are a variety of toppings including vegan options.  In fact, you can choose vegan cheese if you like.  The price was also very reasonable for a large pie.  Overall, i was very satisfied with the pizza as well as the ambiance and service.  I just wished they delivered!

bXjB-7EBZNRgHAWeBL6jFQ.text: I live up the street from Spak and it has been my go to take out shop forever. In the last year the quality has really gone down hill... maybe their fame went to their head? Despite their many recent bad reviews, I gave it three last tries bc I wanted to believe they were still good. Sad to say all three attempts were terrible... the first had a flavorless bland crust with rancid tasting meat, the second was totally burnt and the third got my order completely wrong. I tried calling to set things straight but sat on hold for 35+ mins each time and gave up. I'm sure you don't care, Spak but I'm super bummed to say you lost yet another longtime local's business. :(

JIRl_Ie0BPuPqpgHLvUUPQ.text: Ok! I'm a huge Pittsburgh vegan foodie & this establishment is my all time fav place for take out. Vegan wings, sauces, pizza, dressings as well as the best fries in the burgh. Eco friendly utensils and take out containers. Friendly service- best to call in an order to go, however there's a small place to sit at and eat if one chooses. They even have vegan ranch dressing. Ridiculously delicious

u463pK43xzAYMJxwuHVk-A.text: Food is great quality for the price. Haven't tried anything but the pizzas thus far but hasn't failed us yet.

83362CQCviDwhQlh5JEMDw.text: I've eaten the chicken wings, chicken fingers, both with and without honey mustard dressing, it was worth every penny!

hcUklAVCvcDM3QQdoBpmqw.text: +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ WARNING: Spak Brothers Pizza is the hippest pizzeria ever...you are not nearly cool enough to eat here so you might as well just pack up your Capri Sun and lug your greasy mouth-breathing philistine ass back up to the Dennys there, guy. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++  So I called to order my pizza and I am pretty sure that they just immediately put me on hold just so that they could show off their clever choice in hold music (which was Fugazi-The Waiting Room).  Luckily I am a patient boy and eventually they answered the phone so that I could order my large cheese pizza.  The large is only 14' which I guess is large by the standards of chain stores likes Dominoes but it was only $8 or so so the value isn't bad.    The interior of Spak Brothers Pizza looks like the restaurant version of a southside pan-handling street junkie punks guitar case, I guess it would be charming if I wasn't getting food here.    As for the pizza.....its not bad but its kind of close.    I will start with the positive first, the sauce.  This sauce is strangely original and delicious.  Its very heavy on the herby almost bitter side but they have created a really good balance with it that is quite unique.  The consistency is nice and thick with tomato strips and crushed tomatoes that seem of high quality.  I feel like I am tasting a lot of onion in the sauce but I don't see signs of any, the garlic is heavy but balanced really well.  The garlic brings out the sweetness of the tomato which meets the dark essences of herbs and its all just really nice.  It may be the best sauce I have had yet in the city.  So on to the negative.  These guys are using a brick oven but they use screens to cook the pies.  So what could be pretty ok pizza ends up tasting very close to a chain store floppy crap pizza.  The pizza had a huge puffy crust and a super thin middle so every slice drooped to the ground like a post-cocaine Dirk Diggler penis.  The dough was very flavorless too, the only flavor present at all was a generic taste of salt.  The dough reminds me of Papa Johns...but with salt.  It was a bit squishy but not crunchy at all, I really feel like these Spak Brothers got this dough recipe from their Papa, John.  Maybe if the pizza had been made well and stretched evenly and not made into a bowl shape it could have been less floppy and soggy but with the proportions that were going on it was doomed from the start.  Plus the pizzaman spread the cheese on the pie evenly and didn't account for how the cheese would move while cooking.  So the result was a lot of cheese migrating into the middle which was already too thin so you end up with pooling of grease in the middle and big puffy dry spots of dough on the outside.  They are using a tasty high quality cheese and the portion was pretty good had it been distributed well across the whole pie.  The pie was cooked well and was a good color but did not taste as it looked.    All my bike riding friends tell me that this place has "great seitan wings" or "delicious veggie burger" or "yeah man, you gotta try the tree bark hoagie" and I am sure the Spaks are probably great at making all of that kind of stuff, but they have a ways to go on the pizza.  If they were to hire some real pizzamen and start making the pizza on the brick it would do them a world of good, the execution is the main flaw here.  I would give it a try just for the sauce, I bet this pizza would be pretty good if you were to reheat it on a pizza stone at home and crunch it up a bit.  If you do order from them though you may want to pay a homeless person to go in a pickup your food so that you don't get scoffed at.    Rating: 5/10

lNyI8KwOTXXBs6GB19aMQg.text: Spaks has a special place in my heart. Their food was especially comforting during a rough stay at Childrens Hospital. I could eat that Pittsburgh steak hoagie every day for the rest of my life

fooCdROOUShh7ilrPVh7zg.text: Excellent choice if you are in the area. Usually a quick bite, unless its First Friday, or show across the street.  vegan, vegetarian options. Excellent seitan. Salad is great, especially in the summer. Pizza is delicious, the vegan ones good too. Oh & a side of vegan ranch. Yes please. Not a lot of options for GF but it's a pizza shop. Pinball and art. Def check out Spak, it's a staple.

_Qm-Br8l3e5SBxPwtPlHYg.text: The best non-brick-oven style pizza in Pittsburgh. This is the only place I would recommend picking up a single slice from. The slice has a thin crust but is sturdy enough to fold the slice in half. The tomato sauce is flavorful. The cheese is uncompromised. And the slices come out hot and quick! I was literally in and out within 45 seconds during my last stop.

a9KyjA5o_H99tf0d5fwiVQ.text: They have a seitan "Cheesesteak" hoagie.  It's amazing and I want it EVERY DAY.  Thanks for the addiction, Spak Bros.

aHfjMPgo6VuuEGYNMqy_sQ.text: Tried the seitan wings with one of every wing sauce and they were amazing!! So impressed and will definitely be going back and recommending it to friends!

o33SYTwTx6pqVS4wuNKgFA.text: I feel a little silly giving restaurants such sweeping opinions but damnit, this is the best pizza in Pittsburgh. Every time I go, I expect to feel less confident about this but the confidence actually builds with every experience. Vegan friendly and all natural, they don't even use high fructose corn syrup in their homemade sauce. Their crust is New York style, on the thinner side with a good chew to it but sturdy enough to fold over. Their topping, particularly their cheese, is cooked so that parts are brown. Nothing cooks into a thick, treacherous canvas that is mere seconds away from sliding off onto your nice shirt like Aiello's or Mineo's. They also take cards. The Spak Brother's are nice, nice people and I've been fans of them for a while now. I don't know them personally but I've exchanged emails back and forth due to my review on my site. They know what they're doing and are happy to do it. Everything I've tried on their meny has been delicious. I did a review of them a while back, if you'd like to read it: eatinginpittsburgh.com/2...
