l_z6Hd7TEj2OWWScm9txTQ.text: Vegan junk food at its finest! Spak Brothers is not a large restaurant, but the vegan options seem mouthwateringly endless. Let me tell you, they have one hell of a vegan philly cheese steak. This exceptional vegan junk food sandwich came with well-flavored seitan, green peppers, onions, lettuce, tomato, daiya cheese, and vegenaise all within some very tasty bread. Overall, this was one of my favorite meals in Pittsburgh, and I'll surely go back again during my next visit.

L7aqFb8Z_xSoj8bpUWGh-Q.text: Easily the best hoagies in Pittsburgh. The only downside is the wait can be a little long.

qJ5jG_WoUQICA9ZsLEj2Gg.text: Drive 10 miles to get takeout and was not disappointed. Vegan pizza was totally delicious. Salad was great as well. A bit pricey but worth it. Staff was friendly as well. Worth the effort to get their pizza if you're vegan. Spak's Rules!

iXwEwHDlY7sK98d7XuMkzg.text: Great pizza, nice sauce , not too sweet, all fresh toppings.  Crust nice and thin.     I would put it in my top 3 pizzas in the Burgh!    Staff also super friendly.

r_FXRbNMnHtBF9r-p4KH2Q.text: The pizza was ok.  Tasted like a ripoff of the far superior Grazianos up the street.  Wasn't bad, but didn't live up to the hype. 55 minute wait time didn't help either

Zw-H_puaf5lpdsrAT1Ux-g.text: I ate here tonight for dinner with a dining companion that I have a regular contest to find the best pizza place.  Tonight was my choice and so I chose Spak Brothers as I had seen the good reviews on Yelp and had heard it mentioned in best Pittsburgh pizza joint conversations elsewhere.  Since I had never been here before, I did not know what to expect.  Whenever I walked through the door the first thing that hit me was the wonderful smell of pizza before I noticed what a tiny place it actually was.  That's not to say that there was anything wrong with it as it evoked in my mind what a pizza place should be with two pinball machines, a tabletop arcade game with Ms. Pacman and Space Invaders, a cooler full of water and pop and a bar with high top stools on the other side where you could eat.  They also had some "art" of random superheroes and other things that were for sale hanging from the walls.  My dining companion and I decided to split a whole XL pizza and she wanted it half plain and half chicken instead of our normal plain pizza.  Whenever our pizza came out it both looked and smelled fantastic.  After the first bite I decided it was very good as it had a nice garlicky sauce, a good amount of cheese and the crust/bottom was cooked perfectly.  I was also excited to see that in addition to your normal red hot pepper flakes, oregano, garlic and cheese that you can put on your pizza that they also had Old Bay.  Sometimes unconventional is good and I think in this instance that was definitely the case.  Overall I would currently place this as the third best pizza place that I have tried in Pittsburgh and it is worth your while to come here.  The bottom line for me is that I am already looking forward to coming back here in the future for some more pizza.  Not only was it cheap but it was it was also delicious.  I also told my girlfriend about the old bay and the sauce and now she is ready to come here as well!

J19If_HkwQYLH2t5OZ052g.text: Consistently tasty.  Well-worth any wait time and always perfectly cooked.  I tend to stick with bacon as my only topping, slightly well done crust...great local spot that deserves your $$$.  Order from Spak Brothers, enough said.  You'll be back.

hlGzSMhlLnVXxfxlSgY0hw.text: I think it's awesome that this place has so many vegan options. The vegan pies are heavenly! Some of the best vegan pizza I've had. Plus the seitan buffalo wings can hold their own when it comes scrumptiousness. (i.e., they're tasty.)  I'm going to throw my 5 stars into the fray and say: this place is legit.

j8LV8qkVL-9vOXpUlYuMdQ.text: My coworker owed me a free lunch and I cashed it in for Spak Brothers. I've been searching for the best Philly Chessesteak in Pittsburgh and I've yet to find it....until Spak Brothers! They did not disappoint!!! I didn't pick it up or pay for it so I can't rate my review on anything other than the taste of the food. The bread was fresh and the meat was juicy and tender. I can't wait to go back and try other options on the menu.

0eTVDnRvLLj3g8UXFV6zfA.text: This pizza place has Vegan Options.  Their seitan wings are amazing.  They even have Vegan ranch.  I would recommend to vegans and non vegans alike.  The location has a very small customer area so best bet is to pick it up.  Staff is very friendly.

IR2ejwYlIYSAzDxDmyj9ow.text: Great Seitan melt, Seitan "wings" and cheese fries.  Holy crap is it all so good.  It gets busy so try and order way ahead of time.

CQ1L5puq8VrtGdzM7529LA.text: Spak Bros. provided the seitan for a vegetarian wing-off at Butterjoint. The evening of the wing-off, Butterjoint was packed, and the event was poorly organized. We left and went to the seitan wing originator, and we were infinitely happier for it.  Spak Bros. has very few seats inside, so you might consider calling in and picking an order up -- that's what most people appeared to do. We ordered the BBQ seitan wings and a seitan cheesesteak, which may not have been the best idea, since we were pretty seitan'ed out by the end of the meal, but we took our food to Mixtape and got a couple of cocktails to go with (the highlight of our evening). The wings were a bit salty, so I found that it helps to take smaller bites rather than popping the giant chunks into your mouth. If you've ever been to Veggie Grill in California, I'd say that the wings there are better, in terms of texture and flavor. More celery to balance out saltiness might help with these wings.   The cheesesteak was really good, and I would definitely get it again. Wasn't too dry, had some veggies, and the roll didn't get mushy/kept a good consistency. I used to love cheesesteaks (back when I ate meat), so I was super excited to find a great seitan version.

XLVv9iQPdLb_aLXMI01O_Q.text: Pros: best seitan cheesesteaks/"pittsburgh" hoagies/seitan steak salads everrr; amazing vegan/vegetarian menu; good prices; semi-decent background music choices; interesting/weird/amusingly terrible art work to enjoy while waiting for your order. Cons: the seitan wings are pretty mediocre/have consistency issues; there's a 50% chance they'll get a phone order wrong (on weekend nights the wait is typically at least 45 minutes; and then another 20 when you come to pick your order up and have to stand in line; there's no customer bathroom, which doesn't mix well with gallery crawl drinking; the lack of A/C means the place is about 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer; hipsters. Other pros: the employees are constantly stressed out, often not especially happy to see you, and generally give zero f*#s about whether or not your order is modified according to your goddamn ridiculous requests. It is a glorious pizza shop embodiment of anti-capitalism and the you-don't-know-the-secret-handshake mentality of yinzer Pittsburgh, and it is beautiful.

7TPeDc20l57vCBsn-JTaNg.text: Great buffalo wings, absolutely love it. Price is reasonab, people are nice. Never walk out with disappointment.

whbJkNEgPLmDrNS_VQ2W9Q.text: Oh yeah!  Nice yeasty blistery crust with chewy cheese and sauced perfectly... Perfection!  This is an Absolute MUST if you are in the area-or lucky enough to live nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum!

A81BbD3-xQmL2RpUQMAESA.text: Spak Brothers has a lot of vegan & vegetarian options, which is what always brings me back. I usually order the Setian Pittsburgh Steak hoagie   & I haven't found another place that has a vegetarian sandwich quite like it. The seitan is thin sliced & piled high with peppers, onion, tomato, fries, eggs & mayo. The portions are huge but I usually get a 12 inch anyway to have lunch for the next day. They have a vegan version that doesn't have egg & has vegan cheese on it. Not a huge fan of vegan cheeses myself, but the vegans that I know really enjoy it. There aren't many places a vegan can find fatty foods like cheese fries, pizza & wings, so spak is a good place to go if you're looking to indulge. I usually just go in to order because they are always packed & sometimes if you call you'll be on hold for a long time. They have about 10 seats inside, so probably not the best place to go with a big group unless you want to eat on the large bench beside the shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan Pittsburgh steak. Very messy &amp; delicious.
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_Rzfrh05Peyczpk4-S8e3Q.text: Love the food. I've gone twice, had the hoagie the first time and seitan wings the second. Great prices, and great flavor. Can't wait to try more vegan food! Coming here again for sure. The staff was a little flat in personality, that's why it's only four star. Weren't mean, just flat.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ seitan wings with vegan ranch

_NzE3Lz0qNHOo0nap17dDQ.text: Are you a big fan of organized religion? Or maybe of the occult? If so, this may be the pizza joint for you. Because the only way I can explain the devotion of a certain demographic to this place is through a blind, unquestioning loyalty to a pizza-deity that can neither be seen nor proven. You must just accept this pizza as your higher being, and thou shalt not commit heresy against almighty Spak.  In seriousness - we called in a large pizza on a Saturday afternoon, and were told we had a 45 minute wait. I've never had a single pizza take more than 15-25 minutes to be ready in Pittsburgh. But whatever, it wasn't a big deal. However, when we got our "large" pizza, we were completely disappointed. I wish I had measured it, but my girlfriend and I ate the whole thing within 30 minutes (I don't think a "large" pizza should be easily consumed by two pretty small people?). I would estimate it was 12, maybe 13 inches in diameter. Without exaggeration, this was THE most boring, plain, safe, uninteresting pizza I've ever had. It was as if the cook followed the beginners' guide to pizza recipe, or heating up a frozen pizza. No character at all, no flavor, boring boring boring.   I don't understand the love for this place. I guess if you are vegan it's a nice convenience to have. If you don't have dietary restrictions - there are SO many better pizza places in the city. Don't just blindly bow down at the hipster alter of Spak. Have you ever seen a mom-and-pop pizza joint with their own bumper stickers, let alone see one in the wild? Drive through the East-End and every other Subaru will be adorned with the proud badge of Spak Brothers pizza, on their way to get communion...just don't forget your donation money for the good pizza lord.

BPiyBhrAZCZF7lNTR_nJtg.text: Godspeed, Spak Brothers. Did their rent increase? Price of food? Some explanation for the 35%+ price increase might help me order again. No more Italian sausage sub? Probably not.

UnxPFqcsdcz1yp7Z4P0cUQ.text: Spak had in my opinion one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've eaten, anywhere, even in San Fran and Portland - the seitan steak Pittsburgh style.  I would go out of my way to get it, really, we live over an hour away. .  - until yesterday that is.  I called to place an order for 2 Pittsburgh seitan steak hoagies and an order of seitan wings to go. The lady on the other end of the phone tells me its going to be over $36 .  I hung up, perplexed at this absurd total my husband and I came to discover that Spak brothers has raised their prices by about 40% ??!!  Naturally we called back immediately and canceled that order.  What a huge disappointment this business has turned out to be.  The price on the wings has doubled too. In this day and age people talk, leave reviews ect and I guarantee they will lose a lot more customers beside my husband and I due to this insane price hike.   Maybe its all the Californians moving into the ghettos of pittsburgh, desperately trying to gentrify these miserable little crud hole sub divisions of Yinzerville, - these Google types have a tendency to ruin everything their domicile's come into close contact with. .  That's why everyone's rent is sky high now.   Makes sense that spak may hike their prices up to appease the bearded yuppies, hipsters, and man- bun types who love to pay west coast prices for a silly little vegan sandwich in "Da Ghetto" .  Sad. Best of luck spak. But you lost business and not just mine, that I guarantee.

llbIMXx9lMtvydyt2jLGWg.text: I called in to order for pick up and the person taking my order kept interrupting me. I got a pizza with pepperoni, onions, and green peppers along with bread sticks, which comes with marinara sauce.  I drove over to pick it up and everything was ready when they said it would be. The place itself is pretty small with some art on the walls and one or two video games along the other wall. There was music playing and the people working there were kind of jamming to it and that was cool.  The pizza was so good! Even the crust wasn't too crispy and chewy enough. My pizza wasn't greasy and my bread sticks were soft. The marinara sauce that came with the bread sticks came in two small containers. It was equally as delicious. I was surprised because many times I've come across gross sauce. I'm hooked!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bread sticks with marinara sauce. So good!
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza!

EBUF79EHKxrL84fbJL27Eg.text: Awesome vegan hoagie! Also, solid seitan wings. Very cool. Wish there was a place like this in DC.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan hoagie!

RAVCbTSik9JEhVMiHMbETw.text: We thought we knew Spak Brothers. We love their Vegan pizzas and seitan wings. Then we had their seitan cheesesteak. Mind blown! Awesome vegan sandwich.

pYIiqeH7AO2FXvZi7FHkNg.text: I've been wanting to try Spak forever, so when a friend and I wanted to get takeout yesterday night, I decided to finally try it.  Calling ahead at 5:30pm, we were given an estimate of 20 min., which wasn't too bad and worked out perfectly for us, given the location of my apt.  We showed up at 6pm, and our order was ready for us upon arrival, so after paying, we headed back to my place to consume the goods.  Our order consisted of a medium (14") pepperoni and ricotta pizza and an order of honey mustard seitan wings ($20 together).  The seitan wings were quite good--the best I've had, though I've only had them at one other place in PGH--and the honey mustard sauce was delicious.  The pizza was delicious--in fact, I'd say it was some of the best pizza I've had in PGH, and I've tried many pizza places to date, as can be seen from my pizza list.  While the crust wasn't perfectly crispy the way I like it, it did have some crispness, and I particularly liked the flavor and consistency of the dough once I bit into it.  The toppings were flavorful and well proportioned, and worked well together, despite my doubts that they might be odd together.  My friend was impressed with the wings and pizza, as well, confirming my impressions.  Overall, I'd say that Spak Bros. lived up to its reputation.  A couple of friends of mine who enjoyed Spak and recommended it commented that they don't feel hipster enough when they walk in to pick up their order, and I saw what they mean, since my friend and I definitely looked square compared to all of the employees and other customers.  Even if you're as un-hipster as us, I'd recommend stopping by, since Spak undoubtedly has some of the best pizza in PGH.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ricotta and pepperoni pizza (14&#34;)
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Honey mustard seitan wings

qm0nscigmzZrT6xfK2BM0A.text: Spak is my JAM. I cannot believe the years that have passed without me enjoying all the vegan deliciousness that Spak offers.  My first foray into the various vegan options was the seitan buffalo wings with vegan ranch. I'm telling you, these cruelty-free wings will satisfy plant-based dieters and carnivores alike. And the serving size is very generous - I typically stuff myself silly and then have extras for leftovers. That vegan ranch...so good I feel like I could drink it (I haven't...yet).  I also enjoy the seitan shaved "meat" melt hoagies. Again, filling and delicious. You can make your sandwich fully vegan by substituting vegan cheese instead of dairy cheese.  And if the wings and hoagies aren't enough, Spak also has pizza with vegan cheese, sausage, &  pepperoni. My fav is the sausage.  Keep in mind, Spak can get SUPER busy. Best to call ahead and place your order for pick-up. Sometimes if they are REALLY busy, they can't answer the phone. Wait 5 minutes and call back, believe me, it's worth it. They don't deliver unfortunately :(

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. XL pizza w/ vegan mozzarella, pepperoni, &amp; sausage #amazing

qlJBhiHYtYWA4g9HWL4glw.text: Update: they seem to have worked out the bugs in their phone system and their pizza is still amazing! Buy 3 topping and get one free! They do have excellent prices also.

9bCWHdGMaue-ywuFWc2lRA.text: This place has amazing vegetarian and vegan subs! We tried the vegetarian cheesesteak with seitan and a buffalo seitan sub. Both were amazing!

5_hmbMZfXwSWBw6FWpkDBw.text: I am vegan and came here while I was in Pittsburgh for the first time. I ordered a pizza with onions, mushrooms, sausage and pepperoni and it was so good. But the star of the show was the vegan Philly cheesesteak I shared with my mom. By the time we took one bite we both wished we had gotten our own! It was unbelievable. Definitely try it if you are in the area. I would love to go back and try more! But being in Florida it is a long way to Pittsburgh. Is it crazy to drive 15 hours for a sandwich?!?

9a5w7n_W7qPLPA7kWgBerg.text: Spak Brothers is a great pizza and hoagie shop along Penn Avenue. The pizza and hoagies that I've had are always delicious, and I find myself returning to this little shop when I'm in Bloomfield. For me personally, I find it best to order and take my food to go. The shop doesn't offer much seating for customers dining in, but it does offer some neat old-school arcade games to occupy your time while you wait for your order.    One aspect that I believe could be improved is the checkout/order counter. A more modern and efficient cash register system could help to alleviate the constant struggle I noticed during my latest visit. Tasking one employee with over the phone orders, in-person orders, and processing payments resulted in a large line of customers waiting in the already crammed pizza shop.

G7IBPFtzA3rwjCc-G-zvKg.text: Gimme that sweet seitan!  On my epic quest in search of Pittsburgh's best pizza, much like The Legend of Kung-Fu before me, my path has brought me to Spak Brothers.  In the midst of construction alley in Garfield, you'll find Spak in all its pinball glory. I've tried the pizza twice at this location, and it is undoubtedly better with a topping. The plain cheese seemed a little dry, but not a bad pie. Overall, the pizza gives a good deal amount of cheese and a crisp crust that would satisfy most's pizza cravings.  But what's really great about Spak is their sandwich and vegetarian (specifically seitan) creations! My boyfriend is a strict carnivore and buffalo wing connoisseur, but for him to enjoy seitan wings and then ask for seconds definitely means that Spak is on to something. We've tried both buffalo and garlic parmesan, but they come in just about every flavor you could ask for.  Make sure you put your order in before stopping by to avoid the hectic wait.

ry8OjNAF-J2SuGSL33W0TA.text: Okay, Pittsburghers, I got one thing to say to you: What. The. Heck.  Spak Brothers, I like your pizza just fine. A-ok in my book. Fresh crust, good ingredients that stand up to creative application - I'm 100% down with non-conformity when it comes to pizza. Great musical selections and lots of stuff to look at (and pinball to play). But nothing about this rates a five-star on its own.  But - I can only imagine that the folks giving Spak five stars are inexperienced pizza eaters, are faux-punks shilling for their 'hood, or the pizza is truly terrible in the 'Burgh (not True). Giving your hood love, I get that. Interesting things like seitan wings and vegan cheesesteaks are cool to have on offer. But once you're past the cool factor...Spak ends up middle-of-the-road.  Chalking this up as another one of those, "But, this is so well-reviewed on Yelp!" - can't trust everything you read on the internet - experiences.

XlgfBLl1olPVlLLDyd2_kw.text: I only had one brief opportunity to visit Spak Brothers, and here I am six months later desperately wishing I could somehow teleport myself to Pittsburgh to devour some of those incredible seitan wings and chase them with their absolutely perfect pizza. I would risk turning myself into a fly for those wings, although I guess it would be smarter just to teleport the food across the country.   Although I didn't try it on this visit, they even have casein free soy cheese for the vegans, and veggie sausage and pepperoni options.

TZ_zaKpV3s-GAb31yCHVgg.text: I rolled into this restaurant in my wheelchair and order up a pizza. Upon getting the pizza I wasn't too enthused, looked rather ordinary. I have never been wrong in my life! The first bite filled my mouth with joyous glee. I remembered the greatest times of my life, I laughed, I cried. After I finished my last bite I wiped away the few remaining delicious crumbs from my mouth and walked out, WALKED out.

ZleAxoP8Ev89bacgJLKxbg.text: Spak is one of those places that make you say "hmmm...I'm not so sure this was a good choice" when you pull up out front.  However, in one bite you will realize it was the best choice you could have made.  I had the hardest time deciding what to get but ended up going with a pizza.  So, good and so cheap.  I will definitely be working my way through the rest of the menu, especially since I live so close.  My waistline is going to suffer thanks to Spak Brothers.  So, the "don't judge a book by its cover" rule applies here: the store front at Spak might raise a few brows but their food will win you over with ease.

mPUSAReSqJ5rYUk6unr4gA.text: spak bros keep it real.   awesome chicken wings.  amazing pizzas.  never had something from there i didn't like.

bDrSWnALNXpB6dGK_riARg.text: I'm not vegan, so i don't force seitan on myself.  But the chicken wings here are amazing.  Huge, drowning in sauce, and cooked just right.  The pizza is okay, cheap mostly, but okay as well.  The sandwiches are gigantic and generally a frightening portion size.  I keep going back for the wings.  I suggest you do the same.  Also, call ahead and do it take out, unless you like listening to punk rock and eating off a pac-man machine.

ZcqUSrV9Tr-kHstd34d5Uw.text: pretty terrible pizza, but I'd say it's about par for pittsburgh, where everyone seems to love terrible pizza. I had some offered to me for free last night and I couldn't even finish the slice.   the crust is wan with a mealy crumb, the sauce is too sweet and the cheese has this disturbing thinly viscous texture that I can only describe as being similar to the cheese you get on frozen kosher pizza. maybe they use cheese with vegetarian rennet?  the philly cheese steak was about as good as you're gonna get in pittsburgh, though. meat was sliced thin and cooked w/ decent caramelization. not all crowded and steamed on the grill. so I'll give them an extra star for that.

t0ACGk3my1YhzCiQI1tCbw.text: i visited pitt a couple weekends ago, and this was the first place i ate at.  WOW!  this place is amazing.  they have a great selection on their menu, and the prices are great too.  Their seitan wings and seitan cheesesteak are seriously TO DIE FOR.   their staff are really friendly and inviting, making me feel really welcome so far from home.  when i trek back east again, this is definitely my first food stop.

QElXYGVjwyARkAkBIoPO2g.text: Spak is a great place to eat! It has a cool vibe, hardworking employees, and delicious food. Because everything is made fresh you usually have to wait a moderate amount of time for your food, but nothing too crazy. I am vegetarian and I've had most of their veg options, all which have been wonderful. Their seitan melts/sandwiches and wings are SO good. I really appreciate that Spak uses local ingredients, makes their food with care, and wants to please the customer. I go there at least once a week and recommend it to anyone!

0FLcEeI74b81YdlpSiRhQA.text: Listen up, I'm going to talk specifically about their sweet potato fries. What, they serve pizza, too? How nice. But getting back to those fries, I should mention that they are made by hand from sweet potatoes cut into chunks and deep fried - but not breaded or anything gross like that! Just straight up, fried, sweet potato goodness...they stay pretty neutral in the spice department, neither choosing the Dark Side of chipolte seasoning or the Light Side of cinnamon seasoning  - once again, just straight up sweet potato goodness. I've asked for them blackened - delicious; I've asked for them just barely swirlied in the frier - delicious. I just don't think you can go wrong at $2.47 for the most massive helping of sweet potato fries you've ever seen. And hey, I've been eating them so regularly that I decided to look up a study on the health benefits of sweet potatoes after different cooking methods; obviously, boiled is best, but frying comes out with more beta-carotene than in baking! What! Deal with it, get the sweet potato fries.

nWfYbTkiqmMg21CydcebGw.text: I'm really happy that Spak Brothers exists for all my veggie and vegan friends.  The other reviews here describe those delights well.  But as a hard core carnivore - I will speak for the meat.  After the Bloomfield Grown-up Puppet Cabaret (delicious!) my friends and I strolled down the block to Spak Brothers which I had been wanting to try for awhile.  We ordered an extra large double pepperoni and an order of beef tacos to take home.  My starving friend PK had a chicken parm sub immediately which he reported as terrific.    Now, take into account we were giddy from a puppet show but we loved the pizza and scarfed it down in record time!  Boyfriend lived in NYC for 7 years and grew up in Chicago so is VERY serious about pizza.  He liked it so much that we went back the NEXT DAY to get another pizza, this time half double pepperoni and half pepperoni and ricotta - YUM!    As an aficionado of mexican food (sadly missing in pittsburgh) I was excited to try the beef tacos.  I have it on good authority that a True Taco King lent his recipe to the Spak Bros so I had high expectations.  They fry their own shells which is great.  The format of the tacos however was in a "kit" which by the time we got them home was a mess (10 minute drive tops).  The beef was cold and stuck together with melted but now-cold cheese.  They come with salsa, sour cream, and lettuce all which were fine.  I wish the tacos were preassembled and made to pop in the mouth immediately or somehow temperature separated.  I added my own avocado at home and enjoyed the taste sensation very much.  Pretty darn good for Pittsburgh anyway and surprising to find in a pizza shop.  Try em out.  There are 3 per order for just under $6 and it's a good amount of food.  Boyfriend wanted to share tacos when we ordered the next day so I ordered 6 tacos.  When he made it back with two GIANT bags I realized they thought I was ordering 6 ORDERS of tacos.  That's right, 18 tacos AND an extra large pizza.  A good problem to have.  Party anyone?

oFgRjMLhiBLtUUEvKx5s2Q.text: Pizza is 4/5.  Seitan melt is 6/5 stars.   Cheap and good lunch spot.

XFOneBIbHQTVwfOhPzppCA.text: I am a big fan.  Spak brothers does a good job of balancing healthier ingredients and local produce with great tasting pizza shop food.  I started with the Pizza but I have migrated to the subs.  I wish them the best of luck and will do my part $.  Also you can't beat the punk rock flyers and Fugazi playing on the sound system.

TUsYJlYAHBULbW9LEo3cMg.text: BBQ Seitan sub sandwich is fantastic!  Great for pick up or to sit and have a slice.

Vr7GwykZhCjZ6dPwotJ7vQ.text: Last night I got an email from Yelp with a picture of Spak Brothers Pizza in it. It looked good, so our plans of eating a dinner of string cheese dipped in canned chicken were pushed back to Friday. When we got into the shop, the first thing that struck me as appealing was the music. They had some good old fashioned American hardcore playing, which brought me back to high school. The cheesy bread sticks were very good and really made good use of their dough. The pizza itself was good enough, but not good enough to warrant our trip to the shop. The ambiance was cool. Old flyers from shows back when Laga was open and some local art on the walls gave it a nice touch. Best pizza in Lawrenceville? Maybe. Best pizza in the city? Definitely not. It's also important to note that phone calls take precedence over all else in the shop. While the cashier did politely excuse herself to answer the phone in the middle of us placing our order, it was a little hard to believe that one of the other six people working couldn't have taken the call instead of bagging fake meat for their vegan subs. The people that ordered after us had three phone calls during their order, so I guess I can't complain too much about just one interruption.

2RFyeQXA0knIv13tnLMQXg.text: I didnt find the pizza particularly good.  It wasnt bad, but it had zero flavor.  The crust had no flavor, the sauce had no flavor, the cheese had no flavor.  If I lived across the street, I may settle and come here, but since I am a little bit away and they dont deliver, if I am going to leave the house and walk a bit or drive, Graziano's is much much better.

VK4jLTaRfDG86oarm1NF4Q.text: I could keep eating their food until I explode, like the guy in Monty Python's Meaning of Life.  I think they added the vegetarian Pittsburgh Steak to their menu because I ordered it so many times.  The seitan sandwiches are definitely the highlight and I love them to death.  I should probably give them only 4 stars because their pizza is only so-so on its own, even though it's still the best on the pizza wasteland that is Penn Avenue (but cardboard and wax? wtf? maybe that person got this place confused with Calabria's).  Once you pile it with toppings it's really good.  But I wouldn't get a plain cheese pizza from them.

er9AjI9BW_0c7M1fLWnJNw.text: Food is great, awesome vegetarian and vegan options which is lacking in Pittsburgh. I eat here regularly and enjoy the seitan options or grilled chicken hoagies for a lighter option. Sweet potato fries are the real deal! Salads are fresh and have plenty of veggies on them. I really like the chicken parm hoagie (fried) and my BF always orders the Pittsburgh steak hoagie. The pizza is also awesome- we usually get a large to share between the two of us. Call ahead and place your order- generally takes about 20 min but can be longer when they're busy!

TI3kWQINn4-SvQEbl9Dieg.text: The vegan buffalo wings are my new addiction; by far THE BEST I've ever had! The vegan pizza ain't so bad either! And the prices are mighty fair.  I only wish that broccoli was a topping option and that they would stay open later to feed those intense cravings I have for Frank's Red Hot and grease. I guess the staff wants social lives and perhaps allowing them to be cool contributes to the quality of work they put forth.  We actually ate there at one of the window counters. The cacti are a nice touch; unless one slaps you on the hand while ravenously reaching for a slice, in which case, as my partner learned, they are not so nice after all.

g6hyXS4N3XUzJ8-WKlqR-A.text: Spak Brothers recently opened on Penn Ave and brought a shining beacon of hope to the garfield/east lib/friendship area, serving up sexy slices in the flavors of omnivore, vegetarian, and even *vegan* pizza, hoagies, and wings. Hell, I even travel there all the way from lower Lawrenceville.   First of all, the decor is sparse - I mean, wicked sparse, with a pinball machine, a tabletop arcade machine, and a couple of stools lining the walls. If you require more than that to pick up pizza, you might be in the wrong place. Lacking a tip jar, I heard that the pinball machine IS the tip jar. Stock up on credits for the staff before you leave. Really, though, you should eat on the sidewalk outside with the rest of the bike punx, or take the pizza & wings to a friend's house for a pizza party! The service is friendly and swift. Every time I have been there, the counter staff have all smiled, cracked jokes, and proved to be remarkably efficient at handling my special orders and inane lines of questions. There's a pretty good chance of a Spak Brother taking your order himself. That's charming.   The menu itself is an inspiration and a delight in Pittsburgh's pizza scene. Homemade delicious seitan can be served up in the form of wings or delicious hoagies, in something like 4 flavors (3 of which are vegan). You can order pizzas with a variety of veggie meats - ask what they have in stock to avoid getting your heart broken. OH AND you can order pizza with vegan cheese! Like all vegan cheeses, it falls short of the real deal, but honestly, if you are a hungry vegan in need of a giant cheap pizza to get you through band practice - well, I've heard that Spak is your Lord & Saviour. Note: vegan cheese pizza is best consumed hot. The vegan cheese turns to some kind of alien form after it gets cold. Tastes the same, weird mouthfeel, no fault of the Spaks.   Be prepared to wait a few minutes for your food - the wait is reasonable, but they are actually cooking your food in their gigantic ovens, not just re-heating some frozen pizza back there. Watch a Spak toss some pizza dough. Play some pinball. It's good for your soul.   412-362-SPAK (7725)

h03634tapltqlR8-xwa86Q.text: My friends and I use Spak as a verb. That's how much we like this place. There's no other place like this in town for a vegan. The seitan hoagie is my favorite thing on the menu, and I get it every time.

hvv1QnYB1Gwu3hCdRYu7rg.text: Spak is by far my favorite pizzeria in the city and not only because it's a half-block from my house! I have sampled most of their menu and enjoyed all of it. Their seitan wings are crispy, saucy and delicious. The Pittsburgh "Steak" and Pittsburgh Steak are two of my favorites: sliced seitan or steak with a kitchen-sink topping scheme that includes fries and a fried egg. Perfection! Their pizza is also really great but I think they really shine with their subs.

7y8IxfVj0SjEfxBdMM-3vg.text: I love that they are vegan friendly here! Many vegan options labeled on the menu. I didn't have to forgo cheese either since they had vegan provolone available with my seitan steak. It was a huge portion as I ordered the full size sandwich, but they wrapped it up for me to go and it kept me full for quite a while. Friendly staff. Next time, I will try the 'steak' with BBQ sauce instead of buffalo as it was really hot! Nice atmosphere for sitting and eating in the store. They have stool seating--by the window if you're lucky. It was also fairly quiet when I was in here, which was great. There are paintings on the wall for sale and flyers for upcoming local events as well as pinball machines. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

nWcFt5goEwIsLmnqPUu_LQ.text: Seitan subs alongside philly cheese steaks. Talk about fusion cooking.  Seriously, these guys make a good sub.   Bring some quarters so you can play arcade games while you wait for your sandwich or pizza.   It's a fun crowd during Penn Ave Unblurred and if I lived closer, I'd go a lot more often. Don't miss taking a gander at their "graffiti" exterior wall which was spray-painted during a previous Unblurred event.

PCU8-_b35PyYHadvRv9oOQ.text: Taste was good but it's definitely overpriced. I ordered a white pizza with 4 additional toppings which the 4th one should've been for free but it wasn't. Since it was a white pizza they charged for the toppings that comes on a white pizza. Thanks for telling me. Each topping for a large pizza is 1.64 (at least on their website) I got charged 1.75 and for example I literary had 5 tiny pieces of mushrooms on there, same for the other toppings. I understand that every business wants to make money but it would be nice to get what I pay for. Definitely wasn't the case which sucks because I really liked the taste but I would never go back.

OmSJrRjHoSEsFJ7xHegJnw.text: Can't go wrong with spak brothers. Really good pizza and hoagies.  They know what they're doing.

dUPkut7Lew_H20_TqDs1Tw.text: Pinball, vegan seitan wings, and some of the best vegetarian sausage for I've ever eaten. This place was invented in my dreams and brought into reality by my fairy godmother, or so I like to tell myself. The people working there are super friendly, the local artwork being featured is often extremely unique, and the food is DELICIOUS. The pizzas made from scratch, the ingredients are organic, and I can't speak highly enough about their vegan seitan wings. The buffalo are great, but don't forget to try the honey mustard as well.   Plus, they see my husband and I so often, we often get a few extra wings thrown in. I highly recommend this place, especially to vegetarians that might feel a little left out in a heavily meat-centric city.

BxI_PGXuiaaN2G8fVgHkNA.text: Excellent vegan food for this wall to wall meat locker that is Pittsburgh. Spak Brothers has a mix of vegan and non-vegetarian food on their menu (including wings, sandwiches, and pizzas) which is great because it is still difficult to find alternative proteins available in Pittsburgh restaurants at this time. The seitan Philly sub is amazing--I will go back again for that one. The seitan wings were good too but were too fried and greasy for my taste. They also have a variety of colas (grape, cherry, ginger, root beer, Pennsylvania Punch) to sip on too.  The service is walk up and there are a handful of bar stools around the room if you want to eat in. Toss in a couple of pinball machines and a multi-game tabletop video game (including Donkey Kong), and you have yourself a fun night ahead of you. The people working were super friendly and very helpful too.

nWl-bnc_at4lev6LjbfDVw.text: The pizza was amazing and super cheap. I was told to buckle in my order of fries because there were so many. I can't wait to try more stuff.

s5HeQcDe8EON9uzdn9fM5w.text: Based on other YELP! reviews and some suggestions from friends, we went to Spak Bros. last night. I was intrigued and got the seitan bbq wings. J ordered an Italian hoagie.  We also ordered pizza. My half had spinach and ricotta cheese. Yum!   The 'wings' weren't bad - I liked the homemade bbq sauce, but make no mistake, I'm a fan of the real thing, but these were tasty nonetheless.  I liked the pizza a lot! The crust was crisp and a little chewy...a nice homemade flavor to it as well. I could stand a little more sauce on it, but it was very good.   The Italian hoagie was also tasty....not just ham and bologna. No, this sandwich had sweet capicolla, hot sopressata, and hot capicolla! Truly Italian!

ZhHXd5A6wAXkfD75cI-Wkg.text: Best pizza in Pitt I've had although occasionally not great. But always fast. They'd be an even greater hit if they delivered.

GShiQiqXM2ys_irh8iYgXA.text: Great place to please everyone at the party. They have amazingly good and cheap pizza, their sandwiches are great and they even offer vegan mayo. I have never had a bad experience here.

StB5yXIgdQDRRp1O5XtB5g.text: Everything I have tried here is delicious! The pizza sauce is so good and tastes very fresh!! I enjoy the pin ball machines! Spak really cares about serving high quality, great food! I would rather come here then go to a pizza chain any day!!

6S-Imjv99Db26D0uImN0TA.text: So far, Pittsburgh has proven to be a great city for vegetarians. My friends and I planned to watch Tim Burton's Batman (1989) one friday night and got some Spak Brothers to accompany it after we found out that Little Chicago's in the Southside was closed :(. Anyway, it was a great rebound from that tough loss. We ordered some garlic seitan wings which were a little too crunchy but still phenomenally delicious along with an extra large pizza pie with mushrooms and vegetarian sausage. The pizza was out of this world. Plus, where else are you going to find a pizza place that has vegetarian meat toppings? Extra points for it being in walking distance too.

SHhAoFgkq9VDupSCQH8_QA.text: Great food (for my veggie self and omnivore friends), great prices. My favorite is the buffalo seitan hoagie with the seasoned curly fries! The shop itself is simple but has room to relax if you want to eat a slice there. Not sure why some whiny yelper felt the need to rip on the staff, they've always seemed polite and friendly to me!

6epQxaeuHYf1zKI6qXOwPQ.text: Spak brothers is unbelievable -- great vegan options (faux wings, pizza, and cheesesteak with all the toppings are truly perfect foods), and great carnivore options as well.  Because it's sort of inconvenient to get there for takeout during rush hour, it's a treat when we can do it -- and well worth it!

BGb3KGZEH4CSEI2GBo7TPA.text: Good selection of vegan options which is great for a place like this. The food was good however nothing was spectacular. The one thing I would say was a negative was that it was not the cleanest place in the world and could use some new stools as most of the seats were hole filled. Overall pretty good though.

t4yyo3_Ylqf3gdAWM-n9NA.text: Tried Spak Brothers for the first time because I had heard so many good things about it. Though I'm not vegan, they have so many options for those who are. We tried a pizza with ricotta and spinach, as well as a veggie calzone. Neither were out of the this world, but they were good and fairly priced for the portions. This is a take out spot with easy parking nearby. I'd definitely return and try some other things!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Mx6NiSzSv0X_AM_uKaIVhQ.text: Do you have a vegan or vegetarian in your life? Rock their socks by taking them to this joint. Are you vegan or vegetarian?  Don't walk, but SPRINT and order a vegan cheesesteak. Stop reading this review and just go. Now.   Upon walking in Spak Brothers looks like your classic takeaway joint. A few chairs and a drink cooler. Place your order at the counter and wait for approximately twenty minutes. During that time admire the artwork on the walls and the community events that are posted. But when your order is ready?  Prepare to be wowed. I ordered a vegan cheesesteak w/ vegan mayo, but held the cheese. My first reaction was that I couldn't believe it was vegan. We've all been there. We get stoked for our "seiten whatever" and when it arrives it's blocks of dry deep fried cardboard. Not here. This is insanely great. It's go-back-to-the-counter-to-double-check-if-it's-vegan great.  My only complaint was that I didn't get a larger size. I'll be back and when I do...I'm bringing all of my non-vegan friends to try it. This will make a believer out of anyone.  For the partners out there that aren't vegan that take their partners who are - you'll be the winner tonight. Just sayin.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spak Brothers vegan cheesesteak

05zN-_d2K6Ug5JA9oCwygQ.text: Cool spot with many selections of sandwiches and entrees. They're known for their 12'' hoagie sandwiches!   The staff was pleasant but not the nicest to newcomers. Many locals and many phone-in orders. ****Phone in your order and pick it up. We ordered the seitan wings and 12'' seitan cheese steak and waited 15 minutes.   1. Seitan wings ($5.85): Very crispy and moist on the inside. Had buffalo and vegan ranch (extra $$) sauce on the side. Came with 2 piece of celery sticks. It was pretty tasty for fake meat, wasn't as hard as other places with seitan options.   2. Seitan cheese steak 12'': Very tasty with the grilled onions and peppers. Loved the flavours combining with the cheese. Wish there was a bit more vegan mayo (extra$$) tho. The seitan meat was thinly sliced and pretty moist. We even ordered  second one to go!   Overall, great choice selections, huge portion, great price, ORDER THROUGH THE PHONE.
