Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 12&#34; hoggie vegan sandwhich
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan seitan wings with buffalo and vegan ranch on the side. Very crispy

-2JMbKqJV-zTFb7rxCVYTw.text: It's time for an updated review of Spak Bros., since my reviews should probably update as often as their staff. On average, it's 3-stars. On some nights, it is easily 5-stars; other nights, it's insanely 2-stars. So I'll come somewhere in the middle.  The thing about Spak Bros. is that when it's good - it's damned good. Especially for vegetarians and vegans; Spak has some of the best seitan in the area, whether you go with the wings, or the Pittsburgh Seitan Hoagie. They also offer dairy-free cheese; but the sauce and crust is so good there, that we sometimes opt just getting no cheese at all, and just a ton of veggies on a pizza. The possibilities are endless.  However, there are also some nights when it's near impossible to place an order, even on the phone. And sometimes on those busy nights, when the wait time can be over 2 hours, things can still get overcooked and taste a little on the burnt side.   We tend to be endlessly forgiving with Spak, because it's one of the only places to get vegan pizza, wings, hoagies, etc.; along with Jamaica's Finest Ginger Beer in the cooler. Though it can sometimes be frustrating just to place an order, it's still worth it, and we always come back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan cheese-free pizza. Portobellos, spinach, red pepper, and vegan sausage. AMAZING!

vX0jiEIdQtZS5tHBmrncMQ.text: What once was my favorite place to grab and go vegan cheese steaks and wings is now not worth the cost.   Huge upcost to add vegan options to steaks etc. $13 sandwich?? No thanks. Unless they change it - I'm not going back.

dRe11gQnoUrqchXf7FR_JA.text: The seitan "cheese steak" sandwich from Spak Brothers was such a pleasant surprise! by far the best vegan options in Pittsburgh! I love the vegan pizza and seitan wings as well!! Thank you Spak Brothers for offering amazing vegan options!!

Hsx4VAeW4MicOFb8U2_UKQ.text: A Pittsburgh pizza shop that makes their own vegan ranch and seitan?! What?! When I found out a place like this existed in Pittsburgh, I was so excited and knew I had to check it out. I finally found the opportunity this past Sunday when I was in the area running errands and was looking for a late lunch to pick up and take home. I ordered a large vegan seitan steak sandwich, as well as seitan honey barbecue wings with vegan ranch. Order took less than 30 minutes to prepare and cost under $20. My boyfriend and I split the order and were both impressed. The sandwich was my favorite out of the two orders. Although the seitan doesn't taste exactly like steak (not that I expect it to), it was SO good and flavorful. The bread was tasty and the toppings were great. I did add some red onion at home, which made it taste even better. The seitan wings were good, although really chewy. Still, the sauce and the flavor was perfect. The vegan ranch was really tasty as well! Overall, I loved this place and can't wait to return to try their pizza next time!

_E3RqlPsyyKmfQE2-r5RWQ.text: Ordered my food at 5:49pm via phone call for pick up, was told that the ordered would take 25min. Arrived to Spak's by 6:14p to pick up and pay 71.00 and some change. Needless to say I didn't get my order until 6:45p. When I went to ask the cashier about the order, he just said  "we'll let you know when it's ready," and I said "ok, because I placed my order before 6p, and he said "we'll let you know when it's ready."  I'm thinking, I probably should just refund my order. A few min later there was a man who received his order and was told from the cashier "sorry for the wait, we gave you a partial refund on your order." I'm thinking I hope I receive the same. Unfortunately I wasn't offered an apology nor a partial refund. I've worked in food and customer for a long time, I get both sides of the spectrum, however this was not good service and my mom's food was charred. See photo.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GkgF4fh-mDLpmolGQZr13w.text: Spaks is a good spot if you're new to vegan and haven't figured out how food should taste.  It's not bad by any means, but it's also not spectacular.    The cheese never really melts all the way and they screw up the topping request most of the time.  The seitan "wings" are tasty...but I would just call them seitan meat blobs, because that's what they are...tasty though.  The philly cheesesteak with seitan is actually pretty damn good, BUT the seitan to bread ratio is absolutely pathetic...it definitely needs at least double the seitan to be able to be called a philly cheesesteak.  I would rate it higher if it weren't for the staff.  They basically never answer the phone, which requires going into Lawrenceville and standing in line to order.  I've been there even when NO ONE was in there and they still basically refused to answer the phone as it rang.  I'm definitely not cool enough for Lawrenceville, so it's always a god damned nightmare any time I have to head down there.  Add more seitan to your cheesesteaks, upgrade the vegan cheese, and answer the phone... then this place would be killer.

AYYJp8bSWEcW6HLBFy2Yrg.text: We got a 6" and 12" sub...Seitan Melt and Philly respectively.   I had a spicy melt, too much buffalo sauce and it overpowered the sandwich but my husbands Philly was EPIC I think mine was too - just a bit too saucy....  It's bumping with to go orders, it's really a to go place, I'd order and pick up next time for sure. They've got SO many vegan options its amazing.   Shaved Seitan was the cats ass ~ that's a good thing.   Location is good, parking is good, staff was good.....we will go back for sure.   Long live the Vegan Hoagie.   Also, if you do eat in, be prepared for some pretty decent music.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ulZJws2hFHQDHIYgBwZumw.text: so I looked and found Spak Brothers they have pizzas and hoagies  and wings its a tiny place most folks seems to be getting take out  there is a counter where you can sit plus a table and I came for the vegetarian wings well they really weren't wings more like pieces of "chicken" I chose BBQ sauce plus blue cheese  there were about 15 pieces in the box plus the little cup of blue cheese and 3 celery sticks the chicken seemed a little burnt hard to chew but still very tasty I enjoyed my little snack  they also have bottles of soda with old fashion use a bottle opener caps less then 8 bucks I left satisfied. I need to come back and try their hoagies that come vegetarian version

jO03AFxignJliqMXpb7kjg.text: How grateful I am to have Spaks just up the street from me. Their vegan offering is HUGE and SO delicious, which is what continues to draw me in. Their pizzas are classic and just what you'd expect, with tons of vegan fixins including daiya cheese, soy 'meats', and endless toppings. By far they make the most delicious seitan hoagie in the city limits. The seitan is made in-house, and on the hoagies sliced very thin, piled on top of fresh toasted bread with grilled peppers, onions, etc. The Seitan "Steak" is the best with fresh lettuce, tomato, and vegenaise, just oozing with flavor. Their offering is quite large, everything from specialty pizza, custom pizza, salads, calzones, breadsticks, fries, seitan wings, regular wings, etc. The BBQ & honey mustard seitan wings are the vegan options, and they also make a vegan buffalo sauce & vegan ranch (talk about fresh dill!) which is soooo bomb. Everything that's vegan is clearly marked. Just be sure to specify when ordering vegan! I accidentally got a pizza with all the vegan "meats" and regular cheese--that was my bad. They draw quite a crowd so be prepared to wait for your order...but trust me, it's worth it!

KyJ-ECQuLOfwpdnZQk_DjA.text: Jeez I have no idea why I've never reviewed one of my most fave places before. Probably because I'm too busy devouring the goodness that is Spak Bros! I'm not vegan or vegetarian but I like that they're known for these offerings. It makes for a nice place to eat with my daughter and friends that are vegan. With that said I do like the seitan cheese steak a lot. A really yummy and filling sandwich. The pizza is always fresh and tasty without being over cooked like a lot of other local shops.

vrO7TDLXhp-wKUCMe8PO7w.text: My roommate and I were starving and needed to go grocery shopping.  I really wanted a sub, but the Jimmy Johns in Bakery Square has the worst delivery area ever.  I had seen Spak Brothers on Yelp and was a bit skeptical of the location.  Thank goodness we braved the cold and Garfield.  The Italian hoagie was amazing.  For $8.88, I ended up with three meals out of the hoagie.  The meat was delicious with no fat pieces, and there was the perfect balance and combination of toppings.  I also ordered a slice of cheese pizza for $1.87, and that was delicious as well.  The amount of food you get for the price is amazing.  And to top it all off, they have a thousand vegan options?  I can't wait to come back and try the vegan options too!  The service was efficent, and there are 2 pinball tables at $.75/game to play while you wait for food.  This is definitley a take-out establishment.  Credit cards accepted!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 12&#34; Italian... $8.88
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Slice of cheese pizza... $1.87

ulyg2Q7SbXu09CJjGwyAjw.text: Ordered a large cheese pizza . Nothing fancy..just pizza made with a little love, with the  right amount of sause and cheese. With a touch of a crispy crust. Played some old school pac man while we waited for the pizza... laid back atmosphere with some good tunes playen. Reminded me of the pizza place I went to as a kid.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese pizza

OmNRUwrbAUR6ftGs-do4ow.text: If I wrote this review a year or so ago, it would be 5 stars.  I'm not sure what the deal is recently, but I haven't been super into Spak... IF you can get thru to them to place an order, (once I was super desperate for their wings and waited for over 10 minutes on hold and gave up before I got through) the timing they give you has been consistently way off-- i.e. under estimating the wait by at least 20 minutes! The food is still okay, but much pricier than before.  I think the general crappy service and price surge has somewhat turned me off of Spak for awhile.  Maybe I'll try again in a few months... Bottom line--if you're calling to order, be prepared to wait awhile on hold to place your order; if they take your order in less than 5 minutes, it'll be a happy surprise!!!

GsG99yOv96Jv8xcl7NIOnA.text: I love this place! The bbq seitan melt is seriously my favorite thing to eat ever. My husband and I get food from here almost every week, the staff is very nice and they remember you if you're a regular.

bjUgfeS3BDBUB4R24iVmEA.text: Good pizza (when it's not overdone), and great calzones. Sometimes I get the seitan wings but they are so dang salty that I typically have a dehydration hangover the next day. Also as a lot of people say, it's so annoying to wait on hold for at least 15 minutes each time I call, no matter what time of day. Once my husband waited in line, not kidding, for 40 minutes to pick up an order that was already ready. The cashier just abandoned her station and started filling orders while he waited at the counter. He is a patient man, I would have flipped out and left! Nevertheless we stomach the poor service because we like the food. Just wondering: if people complain so much about your service, I wonder, maybe you guys can work on improving your service? Seems like it would be good for business, call me crazy.

PoMX7EuQHz5iwTvVEVz3Nw.text: Extremely impressed! The staff was friendly, the music was delightfully 80's hair band (Skid Row), and the food was delicious. My boyfriend and I are vegan and very excited to try Spak while visiting Pittsburgh. We ordered both a seitan melt and a seitan cheese steak and these guys did not disappoint; also their French fries were perfectly salted, hot, and fresh.  The only thing I would change about this place is that I wish they were more accommodating to dine-in patrons. There are no tables and very few chairs, so this is definitely a "take-out only" kind of joint.

eR3jPzNi7FBxqe4z_b9YyQ.text: Vegetarians, the Seitan Cheese "Steak" and the Seitan wings are to die for.  Seriously, enough said. I'm not even a vegetarian anymore and I can't help myself.  This is sort of more a carry-out place than an eat-in place. There is limited seating, though, if you want to eat there. There is a small parking lot around the side as well and pretty ample street parking around, too, so no circling around trying to find a parking spot just to pick up your food (I know I'm not the only one who stresses out about these things).  My boyfriend raves about everything they make, but I'm so in love with the Seitan Cheese Steak and the wings that I feel no need to explore further. Yet, anyway.

in627_9BISnYkVEQrxsuhg.text: Great pizza (pepperoni & ex cheese), cheesy bread-sticks and OMG killer pepperoni rolls! Picked food up so no description of atmosphere. Had a very tasty Italian hoagie with hot peppers! will definitely order from Spak Brothers again. Superb pizza sauce. Go see. Tell your friends!

W8SLtZ3g-IAEFS8Z4fvFWg.text: Stopped in to get out of a severe thunderstorm, one of of the workers, Jake made my coworkers and I feel right at home, told us we could hang out until the storm passed. We tried the pizza which was awesome! They also cater to vegan customers too which also went we'll with me. Food was awesome, staff was even better. I'll definitely patronize again!

to6hf6HR6ri1II4RAchcEQ.text: Top notch, best seitan in the city. Even when these dudes are slammed and the line is out the door on a Friday night Unblurred, the wait time is less than 30 minutes and they're always courteous, kind, and appreciative of the business. Seitan cheesesteak with provolone is the perfect recovery meal after a long bike ride or a crap day at work. Add on some curly fries and a grape Red Ribbon for a bonus pick-me-up.

w0UM3nTdc0-KoT6aRBhRtw.text: I love this place. The staff is friendly, it's in a convenient location, and it's really affordable. I have yet to try anything other than their pizza, but that's because their pizza is the best around. Super cheesy, not too greasy, and the crust is nice and crunchy and soft on the inside.

9sWmOfgPkz8kWNk35bgqeQ.text: I do like that this place is socially conscious about where they source ingredients from - that's definitely a good trait that's hard to find in this city.   If you're a vegan - this place is great (as the other reviewers can attest). However, I'm not. The pizza is okay. It's good. I'll eat it if someone else orders it, but I'm not going to go out of my way to get it. There are much better pizza shops all over town that are similarly priced.

V2e3rm-9ymsP-oikAVeIsA.text: The Vegan Buffalo wings are the bomb!!  Best in Pittsburgh! And they have the vegan ranch dressing! YAY!  The vegan toppings for the pizza are great!  We enjoyed two large vegan pizzas.  They were perfect!

AW8q8D9g8IyVKIQA6EE2_Q.text: Everything is delicious. I always get the Buffalo Seitan Melt. Vegan pizza with seisage blows my mind every time (and I ain't even vegan!). Seitan salad is a decadent treat of delights. Play the pinball. Get a soda. Get wet. Mmmmmmmmmmm.

1d2jF6-Vrh7gevV5PTy2Fw.text: This is a typical Pittsburgh sandwich place.  I had the Pittsburgh cheesesteak which wasn't anything like the cheesesteaks I had when I used to live in Philly, not that I really expected it to be in Pittsburgh.  But the meat was kind of dry with no flavor.  However, it was HUGE and fairly cheap for what you get.  It was supposed to come with mayo which I declined and it came with fries inside the sandwich.  I realize this is a Pittsburgh thing but fries really don't belong INSIDE a cheesesteak.  I ordered the sandwich to go (there isn't a lot of indoor seating) and it took awhile for a simple sandwich when there was only one other person waiting.  However, I did enjoy playing the pinball machines while I waited.  I'm not really sure what all the hype is about this place, but maybe their other sandwiches are better.  They do have some interesting vegetarian/vegan options (like a Seitan cheesesteak) that may appeal to some people that would be hard to find elsewhere.

3IgtJuItPIqvFwyeFEVFRg.text: I enjoyed listening to Biz Markie on the ring back tone, but I'd rather you just answer your damn phone cuz I'm Haaangry!

Cru7WbNdOq_KQpc3jrKIIw.text: I was visiting Pittsburgh and staying in nearby Lawrenceville. My friend and I walked up to this place one weekend night, on a whim, mostly drawn in by our curiosity to try the famous seitan wings. It was a good choice! We ordered and ate at the counter. We shared a 14" spinach + feta pizza. The toppings were fresh and the crust was hand tossed, not too thick nor too thin. A classic handmade pizza.   We also split an order of the wings, of course. They were fine, not as exciting as I had hoped - I feel that I've had equally good or better vegan junk food elsewhere. (Then again I've had vegan disasters too, and these were far, far above that!) We had ours with buffalo hot sauce, served with celery and blue cheese for maximum authenticity; spicy and greasy as hell. They may be vegan (well, sans cheese) but healthy? Hmmm....

yOZ1cjy3y52eIt0cuUIHVA.text: The vegan wings are amazing! And that vegan Pittsburgh sandwich is just like I remember the ones from youth before I was vegan. I just wish they had more dine in room, but I've never really had trouble finding a seat. One of these days I'm gonna try that pizza with the vegan cheese if I can keep myself from ordering the wings and sandwich.

48gRQKc65T60yidoFv22Og.text: My goodness, they have great vegan options. Their philly cheese steak tastes like the real thing and you can get the whole thing vegan. This is perfect for the vegan guy who needs a "meaty" fix. They also have vegan seitan wings that are just amazing. Pizza wasn't as good, but still giving 5 stars!! Keep up the great work

MNiDShJfXsz8-_8H8j2LvQ.text: I've been going here for years and I still can't get enough. I go to Spak at every chance I get.   They have lots of vegan options and I love them all. The daiya cheese pizza, seitan hoagie with vegan mayo, seitan tacos, seitan "wings," and seasoned curly fries... All are AWESOME!  Prices are reasonable. Staff is friendly and accommodating. The art on the walls is interesting to look at and is for sale.   If you haven't been here yet, get your a$$ to Spak!

IEmUpudJHIu5QhmkqSLR_A.text: Oh my god! This is the best vegan pizza I've had ANYWHERE. A quaint little place, (reminiscent of Brooklyn), Spak Brothers Pizza is seriously the best vegan pizza ever. In Pittsburgh of all places!  My gal-pal and I went Saturday night and ordered a large with vegan cheese, spinach, vegetarian sausage and olives. All of the ingredients were above par. How the hell do you make vegetarian meat taste that good? By selling your soul to the food devil!? And the vegan cheese was actually cooked PROPERLY. I can't tell you how many places don't do this - the majority, actually - and this pizza was amazing.  I actually told the gentleman who made it my two word review, "Holy shit" and he seemed touched. The olives were GREAT quality - those $10 a pound quality olives you buy at Whole Foods or the equivalent.  Next time I'm through Pittsburgh I'm stopping by and saying hello. You should too!

eGSZlLtxx2V5IfpHSMmjOg.text: Holy Crap, amazing food! Pizza, Seitan wings, etc. All good.  I often get the Seitan Melt -- to die for. Decent prices, too.  Bonuses? -Awesome locally bottled sodas. -Pinball machines. -When painting a mural on the side of the building as advertisement they DID NOT paint over the eulogy graff that was already there. (Respect to the neighborhood.) -One of the prizes in a recent Pittsburgh punk scavenger hunt was one free pizza a week for a YEAR. (Down with the kids.)

KY-llXEYydMULvVjqRsOiA.text: Eat here!!! I think this is THE restaurant that sets the bar for Pittsburgh. Delicious pizza and sandwiches. I have only had their vegetarian sandwiches and those are delicious. I go here about once a week. It is a staple of the neighborhood. Keep it up, Spak Brothers!

Sh2Qc6RCtmRsK_CZ9Ly58w.text: I've been to Spak brothers a handful of times over the past year and every new experience has been worse than the one before. The quality of pizza is mediocre at best- the crust is flavorless, the cheese bland, and the ingredients used sparingly. For the price of their pizzas I would expect something better but they have simply not delivered. Another issue is their menu, which doesn't offer any kind of specialty pizza whatsoever.   Overall, Spak brothers is too pricey for too mediocre of a pizza that doesn't even deliver. If I have to drive out to pick up pizza, I'd rather pay just as much for a higher quality pizza at one of their competitors such as Dinette or even Pizza Sola.

X7fIsYRaXQze5hjqqfKAYw.text: The pizza served is very nice and tasty! I tried it for the firs time after getting bored from Papa John's/Dominos/Pizza Hut but the taste is quite different and that too at a great price. You get 4th topping free with a 3 topping pizza!

Bg4jxUL1qXWBAc8XxxhY-Q.text: I ordered buffalo seitan wings and fries at the counter for take-out.  My husband and I wanted to eat at the restaurant, but it's little more than a take-out counter and a few barstools against the wall.  Oh, and a vintage Addams Family pinball machine that the husband was quite enamored with.  The seitan wings are AMAZING.  I kept wondering if I was eating real meat--no really--did they mess up my order?  Are these really vegan? I'm not eating meat, right? The fries were fresh, hand-cut, salty and delicious--not soggy like so many places in the 'burgh.  I can't speak for the pizza here, but I would definitely stop by again for some more vegan buffalo deliciousness.

1Z-dECFVPM80HjzpZF3AeA.text: I heard how delicious Spak brothers is for vegans and non, but now I am happy to join the club and agree they are five stars!  We were in West Penn hospital and looking for some good grub, when Spak brothers came up I knew right away this is what we wanted.  I had a calzone with veggies and vegan cheese, it was honestly one of the best vegan lunches I have ever had, so delicious! The veggies were fresh and packed inside the calzone - yasss!!!  My husband had the very non vegan buffalo chicken pizza, it looked delicious and he agrees with giving it a five star rating!   I wish we lived closer to eat here more often, may have to make a special trip back, yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie stuffed calzone with vegan cheese!
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza

rWNoohU1XJBNwZSebEL_bw.text: Solid takeout pizza. Good price. Spiced well (not just dough and cheese). It's next to a Mexican food truck with a table set up, which is a nice outdoor area to take your pizza if you don't find room on one of the three counter seats.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni mushroom 10&#34;

NP0J6RCVy6wPNYHBNQ6ZhA.text: Spak Brothers Pizza is a little gem in Garfield near Lawrenceville. Their pizza slices are quite reasonably priced and generous in size. They can make specialty pizzas fresh including vegan cheese! It's not meant to be a sit down place, but there are a few stools to wait for take out or eat your pizza in the place. I loved the art work and old fashion games to play while you wait. They also feature some vegan treats from Goat Gluten Free bakery down the road. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan cheese pizza with pineapple and mushroom
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spak Brothers Pizza

W7g01W2sOjKKNN8vdg6gXQ.text: This place doesn't always answer the phone but when they do they knock it out of the park with the za. They have a great crust on their pizza and the cheese is very good as well. The ranch must be homemade because it takes it to another level. Definitely a go to for anyone in the area. Spak on!

AJUAGY_gm2eoel0M_PeuGQ.text: I highly recommend Spak Brothers! I've been going here for the vegan options that cater to many of my friends. In addition to their vegan options, everything else i've tried has been great. The crust is always super crispy on the bottom and their buffalo chicken pizza with ranch is savory and delicious. If you're ever in the area check them out and take your pizza outside the storefront to enjoy it on the benches!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. buffalo chicken pizza

T_l-7gJL3ADb05rdUA6mow.text: This place is cheap and delicious. I had never heard of seitan before and thought they were just being funny putting "cheese steak" in quotes but they weren't. It's a vegetarian friendly meat substitute and as someone who doesn't eat beef or pork, this piqued my curiosity. It tasted like something I never knew I was missing and immediately made me Google Seitan. It was filling, flavorful, and even the fries inside of the Seitan Pittsburgh sub made me feel like I was in the right place. The sub did fall a part by the end of the experience but the best ones do as it was greasy and it was just an entire meal sandwiched between two pieces of bread. It was the texture of meat without being meat and my mind is blown! It was impossible for this not to taste great as Spak knows their flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Didn&#39;t know what Seitan was before this place.

AZLrZPxHkAyU1jruYP2wtw.text: Groovy local spot, great staff and amazing pizza! The Philly cheesesteaks are so legit, highly recommend! I'd say a top cheesesteak in Pittsburgh! And the little mini pepperoni cups are sooo good.  Ingredients are super fresh and they have vegan options, which is a plus! If you are in Garfield, check this place out, you won't be disappointed! One of my go to spots in the 'burgh for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic pepperoni with extra cheese

tAqA18wRJCDW8pZmYGDXxQ.text: I've lived in Pittsburgh for 3 years and have never been able to find a a better vegetarian "meat" sandwich at such an affordable price. Everyone has been telling me to check out this place for a while but I'm usually not in that area. MAN I wish I would have found this place earlier. Incredible seitan, they shred it and cook it to perfection. It's definitely not a place to sit down, especially in the summer because the restaurant gets super hot. I am going back as soon as possible tbh to try out whatever else they have that's vegetarian. Good food, good price, good portions. Please take the time to visit this place especially if you're vegetarian.

hvnWeQdiSGwnJGY0f88GVQ.text: I used to work within walking distance of Spak and ordered it for lunch often. I usually ordered their salads or sandwiches but am also a big fan of the pizza! A great option for takeout.

8DlAlonfrTRMXMsTvl7BeA.text: I always leave a tip to hardworking staff, but after coming into this place, I couldn't bring myself to leave one. Came in here while passing through on Sunday (Mother's day) around 830pm. I've never been here before, so I asked the girl at the counter if there were any vegan options. She looked at me like I was an idiot and said "Uh, yeah, we have a lot of vegan options". Kinda with a "no shit Sherlock" tone of voice. I was taken aback, unsure of how to respond or if she was joking. I wanted to respond "well how the fuck was I supposed to know?", but I was really hungry and didn't want anyone to spit in my food, and plus this was the only place around open on a Sunday night.   Instead of showing me the menu and pointing out what was vegan, she continued looking annoyed that I was now wasting her time because I didn't have my order ready. There was no one else in the restaurant at this time, so it didn't really make sense that she was in a hurry. I think what she was in a hurry for was cracking jokes with her coworkers, because she seemed way more charismatic and friendly towards them than myself and any other customer that walked in while I was there.   Now, I do feel kind of bad for not tipping and for leaving this review, because the food was decent and the other employees there were working hard. However, I've never had such shitty customer service in a restaurant before, and I will not ever come back here or recommend this spot to anyone else. I'm a pretty easy going and understanding guy, but I've never left a restaurant feeling straight up angry before.

6K_LhwEPCjyNvVete5BR1A.text: Giving them 5 stars completely based on their vegan cheese steak . Drooling now just thinking about it. Very impressed with all of their hoagies. The vegan pizzas are good too. Not that best I ever had but still not bad for vegan food. I prefer violife for vegan cheese on pizza's. But that's just me. Overall, great place for vegans and non vegans. Wish they had gluten free options (maybe soon!?). The wait wasn't very long and the staff was very friendly. Prices fair for vegan food. Free back street parking.

HkO_czE-q4rfw8pUrNx0_g.text: They need to deliver to the community they are making their money off of. The community is feeding them. They should be more accommodating. Have more delivery platforms available. Be more accessible... Blah blah...

_bcPcubd-S2fcba7nPcUag.text: Great pizza and really great vegetarian/vegan options. I almost always get the wings too. Friendly service, there's some counter space to eat-in, but I usually take it home.

Vs4g6fFOBLE5Moy5o-8-cw.text: This place is AMAZING for vegans.   I've tried their pizza, seitan cheesesteak and seitan wings! All are delicious!  I've had their buffalo seitan pizza and a mushroom pizza. Their vegan cheese is so soft and melty, I love it. Their seitan is very textured and delicious. They make their own homemade seitan! And their vegan ranch is to DIE for! I can't get enough. The pizza is super tasty here.   The seitan cheesesteak is unbelievable. I couldn't fathom how it wasn't actually meat! They slice the seitan like thinly sliced steak and top it with vegan cheese, mayo and vegetables. It was super good. The seitan wings were really good too!  You gotta try this place if you're a vegan in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan buffalo wings
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan vegan cheesesteak
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seitan vegan cheesesteak

N05PjuSlGfRl7-mevlEKEw.text: The best steak and cheese hoagie I have ever had! I ordered the Pittsburgh steak and cheese hoagie (w/ real steak) and OMG perfect! French fries and egg on your hoagie!! What's not to love about that??!!! Every bite was juicy and flavorful and the bread was the perfect amount of crispy, not over toasted.  I have had their vegan pizza a while ago and remember it was really good too.  I love that they use a soy free cheese, daiya cheese. If you are not a fan of soy, like myself, daiya is a great alternative and tastes way better than anything soy! I think I might start coming here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The best steak and cheese hoagie w/ french fries and egg!

VyNWxerGz5bh0fcZ6gEH2A.text: I can't say enough good things about Spak. Locally sourced. Vegan. Friendly staff. Awesome music. It's really amazing.   I've been visiting Spak for over three years now and remain a loyal customer. They have THE BEST vegan wings out there. Huge fan. Their vegan ranch is also bomb and pairs well with the wings and salad. Seitan salads are usually my go-to, with delicious seitan, fries, vegan cheese, and some veggies thrown in there. Couldn't ask for anything better.   They also have amazing sandwiches. Buffalo seitan, bbq seitan, and vegan cheesesteak are all phenomenal. I can't pick my favorite. One thing they could add would be delivery as there are many times I don't feel like changing out of my lazy clothes, and then I realize it's so chill that no one cares what you look like. Spak is where it's at.

qBsrE_fOfM42QFRuMib6aQ.text: I drive 2 hours to get their cheesesteaks and french fries. Vegan, of course, there's no better option around. Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend gets the vegan buffalo melt and loves it just as much. Even the breadsticks, cheese or no cheese, amazing. Came here on my birthday from Cleveland, just to have one! :) Highly recommend!

chsHuJixP6SyvzqN5VeCIg.text: 1st time visitor. Cool staff very nice. Place was hopping at 7pm on a Thursday. Lots and lots of take out orders happening while we waited for our food. Ordered the vegan cheesesteak and it was THE bomb! Great taste and super tasty bread. I would highly recommend it. Also had curly fries which were pretty normal. The seitan wings were very very good. Super spicy buffalo sauce and you get a lot for the price. Cannot wait to go back and try some other stuff. Only bad part was the wait but it may have just been that we were there when it was busy.

twwmI4gW-XCOVf0z1xe19Q.text: Let me start of saying that that upon arrival at 3:05ish, the place was already bustling. This was super encouraging for a small pizza joint that I was hitting up on my way to 376.   Drenched in hipster marinade, the interior was inviting. There's a bunch of rad artwork and memorabilia inside the place, including a pinball machine, a signed setlist from the band Hanson, and cultural artwork, representing sports, music, comics, and more. Despite the cozy and unique interior, seating is limited to a small bar and some stools situated around half of the perimeter, so if your party is larger than two, it may be best to dine at home.   But I'm not Martha Stewart, this isn't the good housekeeping forums, and you're here for the food review. The best slice of pizza I've had in Pittsburgh, bar none. Crispy crust, a good marinara, and melty cheese that has been cooked long enough to start developing those signature brown bubbles. The chicken parm hoagie and chicken tenders were similarly good. Nothing beats a good, fresh fried chicken in any form. The hoagie was made with garlic bread and the chicken, sauce, and cheese components did their job (though I would've fancied some more marinara on my hoagie). The sauces for the chicken tenders were good for me, but mom disliked the spice in the bbq and honey mustard (which both had the spice of a medium wing sauce). Keep in mind if you have someone averse to heat.  Overall great lunch experience. 4.5/5 (rounding up for the exceptional service we received, and the presence of my favorite soda, Cheerwine, in the fridge)

l-QWYhwaBobYIxf_mU4JxA.text: I'm back on board with Spak Brothers. Their prices are more fair and it seems like they're working on their customer service. The food is amazing.   It still takes some time to get someone on the phone and the wait times for takeout can be long, but I can't blame the place for being busy. It's too good!

zFX3kGLH4PmLyMM1Aw1B6Q.text: Based on the rave reviews of Spak Brothers I was very excited to try it this past weekend. I called on a Saturday night around 6:30, ordered a large pizza with hot sausage and banana peppers for pick up. The kind people on the other end of the phone line said it would be 20 minutes and $12, not bad at all.  Despite being very busy when I stopped in to pick up my pizza (there was a concert across the street) they had my pizza ready and waiting for me. This is where the story goes from overly pleased to "Meh". The pizza was just mediocre. The crust was very chewy and on the hard side. By the time the pizza cooled it was nearly impossible to bite through without really going at it. The sauce and toppings were also just OK.  Despite the service and the price being amazing, the pizza just wasn't good enough to warrent me going out of my way for it. This really bummed me out!!!

HmfLBUt57038UIArCbO4-w.text: Spak Brothers is the best pizza shop in the city. The wing sauces are incredible! Great people own the place and it's very easy to support.

nzlHRIu5e2LaLSGyPohBxg.text: Small local business. And that's just a fraction of what I love about the place. Amazing pizza is another.

c-RfOpda8oSsoM9j8BWf1g.text: Vegans, Spak Brothers is your hipster-tastic place to satisfy your pizza craving. I heard the hoagies are good too, but honestly, I can make those at home. They have a pizza oven and the only other place in Pittsburgh with vegan pizza that I know of is the East End Food Co-op. So yeah, I got a small pizza (I don't believe they do slices for vegan cheese) with double spinach topping and it was sooo good that it didn't survive the walk to the bus stop.   For one somewhat hungry person, the 10" SM pizza will do. Don't get the taco kit if the kitchen is busy (like during First Fridays/Unblurred events) because you'll see so many people get their food before you get this container of stale taco shells with a few lifeless shreds of lettuce in there.   They have 2 pinball machines for entertainment while you wait for your food!

Z7y2VKHbiuQ8ajSc5vamSA.text: Yum! The boy and I are on a vegetarian kick right now and if I'm in the mood for something like a Philly Cheese Steak this is where I go! Their seitan wings are tasty, their Philly Cheese "Steak" is good, their cheesy bread is amazing. It's a must try if you are in the area!

nrOV_HyFHzgSvWxQfTPMyw.text: I love Spak. I usually have to have Spak at least once a week or I feel like something is missing from my life. This place is a Pittsburgh treasure.  The vegan options are awesome, especially the seitan wings with vegan buffalo sauce. I routinely ask for a side of vegan buffalo sauce with everything I order and when I forget, they usually include it anyway because they know me better than I know myself. Try a seitan melt. You won't regret it.  I don't want to talk about how much weight I gained during the first year of Spak.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

s-P45HwvMJKvPF6NrD-4gA.text: Good pizza, good people, great place. I came in around closing time to satisfy a late night pizza craving, and the staff was friendly and laid back despite my late arrival. The pizza didn't take long, and it was still warm by the time I got it back to my hotel room. It wasn't too greasy, had a great balance of toppings, and the sauce was slightly sweet and excellent. They also have vegetarian options, but I'm a carnivore at heart so I can't comment on those. Give these guys a shot if you're in the area!

xPMQMjbrdXHoLqrcKyj0kg.text: My favorite take-out food place. I live about 3 blocks down from Spak, so they are naturally on speed dial when I want some good veggie-friendly food made fast. Their seitan wings are BY FAR the best in the city- particularly the BBQ and honey mustard flavors- and food is freakin cheap! The last time I went I ordered a pizza, seitan wings, and fries all for about 15 bucks. The pizza is maybe a bit above par, far from the best, but it's fast, easy, cheap, and overall good quality. The people are great, one negative for some will be that there is no delivery- but who can hate on picking up this amazing food at such a small and intimate hipster/punk pizza place? Tip them well because those guys work hard!

BOSZLXtSwPE5m-CnB0pLCQ.text: Spak delivers a very solid pizza at a very reasonable price.  I had the best intentions of splitting their XL pizza with my wife and saving the left over for lunch the next day.  That didn't happen.  The splitting part sort of did, but we ended up eating the whole thing and left nothing for leftovers.    The staff are super friendly and remind a little bit of Austin.  Thanks Spak for bringing a little spunk to the neighborhood!

_wsVTOhV0jfaVVm44A0SCg.text: $2 slices, local ingredients, and absolutely in the hood...it's pretty fabulous.  II will admit, I've always wondered what food came out of this very modest building in Garfield.  The only thing I'm wondering now is why I waited so long to try it?!  After reading the menu I decided since it was my first trip I'd go the route of pizza per recommendation of Pittsburgh magazine. I was not disappointed!   It's simple, the crust is excellent, they don't skimp on toppings (even though I just went with basic mushrooms this time...I will absolutely be more adventurous in the future!) and the service was friendly and polite.   I did spy some type of sub being cooked in the oven alongside my pizza...and there was a hefty portion of meat on that bun!  I can't wait to go back...great local spot!

kpMMKQpoDJq0nMl792wqig.text: Spak brothers is amazing, I work a block away and eat there 2 or 3 times a week. I'm never disappointed with the quality of the ingredients they put into their menu items, seemingly designed by over-qualified snack wizards hailing from the highest echelons of stoner munchy-ness. Best pizza in town in my opinion. If only they would go ahead and put gummy bear pizza on the menu I would want for nothing.

Zv7dcM7thApdTEI_4lbSOg.text: My boyfriend always gets the pizza and I get the seitan wings. No one does seitan wings better in Pittsburgh than Spak Bros!

MtPwMo-LV9DwcVlQecasVg.text: They have the best seitan wings and hoagies!  What is seitan? Well, is a food made from gluten, the main protein of wheat. It's low in carbs, high in protein, it doesn't have any animal fat, it's vegan and it's delicious.

eNRLRaIJGdgHZz7WAXsukg.text: Spaks is located near where I work so it has become a lunchtime favorite. I try to stay as healthy as possible when lunching throughout the week because I know that when the weekend hits I'll be taking down some calorie inflating meals.  I first started ordering the salads. I would get the garden salad stocked full of tomato, cucumber, peppers, roasted chicken and an egg. Protein "loco" or "loca" cuz I'm a chick! The chicken is very tender and juicy, the egg when added to the salad is sunny side fried? A little strange but doable. Now the greens I have a problem with! Romain would make such a difference. They get the standard mixed greens but at times it can be pretty bitter. Too much "octopus" lettuce that is hard to chew. The last time I ordered the salad was greasy from the egg and I can't get it anymore.  One of the reasons we order from Spaks is because the Dr. at  my practice is super strict about her diet and enjoys the vegan friendly choices. Faux pepperoni, cheese, wings, and seitan. I've tried them all and they are scrumptious! Now when we order I get the seitan melt. Not the salad option that I prefer but until I can get some Romain it will do. Ok it's better than "it will do" Soft buttery bread with all the veggie fixings I require. I think I just feel guilty because of the high carb count in the bread.   The pizza is also well made, one of the best in Pitt. Of course the most outstanding item on the menu is the seitan wings, spicy and crunchy just how I like them!

1rfTmOH1pmdnNKt0T9jQZw.text: It's pretty righteous.  I prefer Sola, but I dig it.  Good to go to after a gallery crawl.

jFPcHdtPjQqNoIWrowBl0w.text: As close to New York pizza as I've been able to find here in the 'Burgh.  Love the thin crust and the sauce as well.  Done kind of crispy like I like it.  Always a big treat.  Love these guys!

OF0JCe9O0QaP85jwkonTAA.text: Awesome food. Never had a disappointing menu item. Seitan Wings are as good or better than the real thing! Great take-out spot.

Ccrno4CPUH0fv63lNxq7nw.text: What's the deal? This Pizza is only ok...Angelos is better, but I still haven't found a favorite spot. Spak skimps on toppings, I like the divey decor and the workers I only wish the Pizza were as compelling.

NMQOIauz48ym80CGdEvsaw.text: If you're a vegan then def come here!  They have soy cheese for your pizza (and it's daiya, the good kind).    Came here for lunch and it had a cute decor.  The vegan pizza was giving my girlfriend mouth orgasms.  I had a pepperoni slice (not vegan) and it was pretty dang tasty!  Seems like this place has a great take-out business with their sandwiches.  I can't wait to go back and try them because they smelled amazing.  I know my girlfriend is excited to try their vegan philly seitan melt.  Oh, and it's cheap too!

FvBiy6AVNYMx4FyqV8hFkg.text: Hoagies and pizza always delicious! We order from here 2-3 times a month and have been for the last 5 years. I've never been disappointed.

QI_oqhDgkzeiLB_I44THeQ.text: Top notch pizza, but often hard to get ahold of! I've called three or four times where no one answered, even after a good two minutes of letting the phone ring. It's worth it when you can get it, though!

2jfrpBDvJ3LrDdXcKzHcTw.text: Spaks is a great pizza place located right on Penn Ave in Garfield. Their plain cheese is delicious, as is everything else! Their seitan wings are awesome and they have lots of vegetarian options. Service is good but they get busy so be patient!

lGtAhfzaelt3nKJ_zqTLJw.text: Never go here, order from here, dine in here....these a**holes support terrorism and take a seat during the national anthem...I hope they rot in hell, at least there the pizza would be fully cooked.  I cannot believe the lack of professionalism and customer service these dough rollers displayed.   Order take out you ask? Sure, then show up when it's supposed to be ready and be told to wait in an hour long line while your pizza turns to cardboard...hell, I'd actually rather eat cardboard than what these cheese turds put in a box.  This place must be a front for meth they peddle out the back door bc I have no idea why anyone who got treated the way I did would go back and support this place, unless for meth.  When David Mills in Se7en hysterically asks, "What's in the box?! What's in the box?!?!" I'd tell him, "Well, at least it's not Spak Brothers pizza."

lT8QLTqwG1khwgjGcobupg.text: I've been trying to visit this place for a long time.  We ordered a large pizza with steak, half pineapple and half banana pepper, jumbo chicken wings, french fries and breadsticks. The order got ready in about 20 minutes. I'm not a big fan of the marinara sauce probably due to the herbs in it. The pizza was good. I prefer pineapple than banana pepper. Nice to get whole chicken wings. Ah, I really like their fries: crispy and chewy.  I'll come back to try their seitan wings and hoagies.

CqHIfdE0hRQuEPCwB90NEQ.text: LOVE Spak Brothers This is one of our favorite places to eat.  The vegan cheese steak and french fries are sooooo good.  We BYOB and play pinball while waiting for our food.  The food is awesome, the music is great, and the staff is nice.  It's always a treat to go to Spak Brothers.

iHbxI9B6bZsasLUDG7pc_g.text: For a pizza joint, they have one of the best salads of any fast food/ casual take out places in Pittsburgh. The garden salad with chicken is always extremely fresh and delicious. I love the carrot ginger dressing.  Their pizza is pretty good too!

oW-m3YCmBhnU9cwEdfe6Fw.text: Great pigging out comfort food.  I was visiting great friends in Pittsburgh who suggested this spot for carry out. My girlfriend and I had spent the entire morning driving up from MD and dealing with horrendous traffic. We were starved.  We placed our order over the phone and picked up. Our food wasn't quite ready as estimated but the wait wasn't too long and well worth it if I may say so.  The service was alright. Not necessarily the friendliest.  We ordered the following;  Pittsburgh Steak Sandwiches Fried Chicken Salad w/Honey Mustard Vegan Sausage & Veggie Pizza  French Fries  Everything was delicious. Both meat and vegan products. The honey mustard is made in house and pretty darn good. I had no complaints!

yshtzMGJdWat0DF8h9pujQ.text: This place is my lifeblood. As a vegan, I am a pretty healthy eater, but lord --sometimes you just need a damn pizza. I love their vega pizza with pepperoni. They even have vegan ranch! Their BBQ sriram sandwich is my go-to, but their vegan wings are a close second.   Not only is their food spectacular, but they also have quick & friendly service. I have legitimately never had a bad experience at Spak. Best food in Garfield!

kGrF6xqPBQZzHQBT0SR0Yw.text: Delicious! Love that this is a pizza place with so many wonderful, diverse vegan options. Ordered the vegan cheese steak and vegan buffalo melt. Gah! I regret not ordering the whole foot long hoagie, because that was just too good! ! The environment and staff was super chill, loved the artwork. Ordered the food on-site and it was ready in less than 15 minutes! I don't love nearby, but I know that any future pizza party I have, will be ordered from here! !!

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The delicious seitan buffalo melt (I got the 6&#34;). Wish I got the whole foot, that was beyond delicious! Hail Seitan!

KlQLQF2O32o8W7VQIR0HDQ.text: I love Spak. There is something about their pizza that is just so good.   I usually stick to something fairly simple here--tonight I just got pepperoni. It's always awesome though and I've never had a bad experience. They're also fairly quick with getting orders ready, even on busy nights. My friend gets the fried chicken salad with a side of buffalo sauce. I need to try that next time--it always looks awesome!

P0uU2S2WAiY4_0kYT_DiTQ.text: We LOOOOVE Spak Brothers. We're from Cleveland, so we only get to visit them a few times a year and when we do, we make sure to order the seitan wings, seitan cheesesteak, seitan melt, and pizza. Yes, it's that good. They have so many different options for vegans and vegetarians. You can't beat the prices either!  And as a bonus? The employees are REALLY NICE! Even when I mention we're from Cleveland! The only downside is that they're sooo far away. I have been trying to slowly consume my seitan wings and take smaller slices of my cheesesteak to make it last longer, but soon my slices of heaven will be gone.  If you're from the area, you're lucky. Go to Spak's and support them, they're awesome. If you're just visiting? Definitely hit them up. You won't be disappointed!

xqpoSOUjgB0OhGC_x9UE2w.text: I love Spak Bros. The hoagies and pizza are the best you will find in this neighborhood. The cheese fries and breadsticks are awesome too! Only draw back is that you generally have to wait awhile in store for your order to be done. With that being said, bring some quarters for their cool pinball machines or just add about 5-10 minutes to the time you're told on the phone when you order.

IQg4ZwbKz7Uw5nxhqXg6MQ.text: I can't even begin to speak as to how much I love this place. It was  the first place I ate when I moved to Pittsburgh. It will be the last if I ever leave this fantastic city. It has the best vegetarian fast food on this planet. The buffalo seitan melt and seitan wings are legendary. The pizza though.... It will blow your mind. Also. VEGAN OPTIONS. Go here.

CtmF4jY2Tg3-jBgAhrtzDg.text: Best. Hoagies. Best. Everything.   Chicken parm sub is absolutely superb, though the fried chicken suits my fancy more than the healthier grilled chicken.  They ran out of sweet potato fries when I ran in to grab a to-go order and offered not to charge for the half order i did receive, as well as gave me a full order of regular fries for free.

vO95LSVOMnEluZsX4acUQQ.text: Easily one of my favorite pizza joints in pittsburgh, maybe anywhere. I stop in and grab a slice or two just about everytime i drive by.

X7azeFK3qv82M1IqAYaa3Q.text: Biggest complaint about this place?  Lack of delivery.  That said, if they delivered I'd probably be ordering it every other day, so the lack of delivery is actually probably a good thing.  This is not my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh (I think Pizza Sola in Oakland is far superior in overall flavor/consistency/essence-of-pizza-ness).  But it is a close second out of those I have tried.  The pizza is thin, a la New York style, although I would say not as greasy.  The thing that makes this place extra special, though, is the veg- and vegan-friendliness of their menu.  In addition to pizza, they have great vegan wings (although the Buffalo sauce is not vegan) and a bunch of traditional sub-style sandwiches made with vegan and vegetarian alternatives.  What Spak does that no other place in PGH that I'm aware of does, is cater to those meat-like junk food cravings that vegetarians are occasionally susceptible to.  The pizza would be enough to keep us coming back, but the fact that they can fill my craving for Buffalo wings?  Awesome.  One thing to note: the shelf-life of some of the veg substitutions can be short.  If you have a long way to go to get home, consider eating there, or finding a nearby bench if the weather is nice.

RKmGP1fqkI-goOmTDHTz5A.text: Really really good pizza. Very similar to other pizza joints though. Probably the best bet over in that area. Definitely will go back if I'm looking for pizza in the area again.

kd6ksAfHLAPPePOtDNCITw.text: My first time at Spak was a good one. I ordered the Pittsburgh steak hoagie. 6 bucks and I was very full afterwards. Everything meshed great together and was probably the best hoagie I've had in a while. I will be returning for sure soon to try the pizza. Also the two people I was with ate vegetarian style fair and loved it.  Edit:  Upon returning to spak at least a dozen more times since I made this post, I've tried every sub on the menu and enjoyed every one of them. The pizza was also top notch. Pricing is on point and staff is always friendly.

8R1EFlmkat2s76UcBVHl3Q.text: Great pizza!  I had the vegan cheese and veggie substitute pepperoni and sausage with jalapenos. Fast, delicious, and I got to play some pinball while I waited.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Personal size pizza (vegan cheese, veggie substitute pepperoni and sausage, and jalapeños)

cuktk52HwB7PNcoJkWuz8Q.text: Spak Brothers is my favorite pizza.  I've eaten here dozens of times and each order is accurate and maintaining of the quality I expect.  Spak Brothers pizza is excellent.  The dough is great, the sauce is great, and the toppings are fresh.  Spak seems to put a lot of effort in to the quality of the toppings.  I also get Italian hoagies from them.  I like my hoagie meat crispy on the edges and Spak delivers.  The buns are also excellent.  Overall a quality place.

dPLaAP1j9w2t224t09mpQw.text: Spak Brothers is some of my favorite food in all of Pittsburgh. This place is absolutely heaven for vegans! I always get an order of the seitan wings with vegan buffalo sauce and vegan ranch (get extra). The pizza is awesome! They have a wide variety of veg-friendly pizza toppings, including pepperoni, sausage, and daiya mozzarella and cheddar.   The first time I went here (with my husband and kids in tow), I didn't realize that there was very limited seating, so be prepared to take out. In warm weather, it gets very hot inside the restaurant due to the ovens, so you may not want to sit inside anyway. There are a couple of benches outside on the sidewalk that people sit at to eat. Also, sometimes there is a long wait time, so call early. We usually order and bring it home, pop it onto a pizza stone and heat it back up. Still delicious and worth the drive for us.  The service is always friendly and they are always happy to answer questions about toppings, ingredients, etc.  I always say that the next time, I will try one of their vegan sandwiches, but so far, I cannot give up the seitan wings and pizza. Just awesome food!!

YDkWLBUj0Ptg5m1Hq4UyDA.text: I love this place. The veg options are so good I love the seitan phittsburgh "stake" It's crunchy, toasty, and has so many yummy ingredients, what is not to love. It's always packed but I feel like wait time has gotten better from 4 months ago. It's also so cheap :)  Almost gave it 4 stars because I've had to wait an hour to pickup a sub, limited seating and sometimes the cashier (only once) has had an attitude.

9xbvZ_OBQ1WeU16F_ZrXCw.text: 3rd strike.  Im still trying to figure out what the big deal is here. Thrice the disappointment. The pizza is nothing special,  each time the pies are underdone,  this is inspite of the insistence that they bake them well done.  I would expect that would not be a problem given the hour+ the pizza took (was quoted 25 -30 min).   The pizza overall I find bland, the notable exception was the peperoni,  a higher quality than average.  But that could not offset the below average balance of everything else, dough,  sauce,  cheese,  and most notably the service.   I guess the hipster millennial types flock for vegan fair?   .

PQvD3Q0dWPtXt-cAsAa4nA.text: First time trying Spak Brothers and I was not disappointed! Ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and green peppers and it was delicious!

p5ecXlM8-EWheoJV5Ubmxw.text: This place is awesome! I love the fact that they have vegetarian and vegan options. The seitan wings are delicious, their pizza is really good and the sandwiches are honestly the best around.

EBixFdNigmDEGghKesTw4g.text: MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT IN ALL OF PITTS! This place is fantastic and I wish I lived closer, I'd get it once a week!

FtI0uGMTsvrpbpA9O2Blew.text: As far as neighborhood pizza joints go, this one kills. Best in town. I grew up with Philly pizza, so, I am picky. There's lots of just bad pizza in Pgh, but not here. Here, they get that the triumvirate of pizza is a balance of crust, cheese, and a good sauce that blends with all the other flavors. If all really you want a giant pile of rubbery provolone, put on your mullet wig, hop in your IROC, and drive to Mineo's. Me? I need a slice I can fold.  I like the punk rock vibe, and they are all business. Got a vegan/vegetarian friend? Bring 'em along. I am not a vegetarian, but I will sometimes get the seitan wings just because they're so tasty.   They also have ginger beer, and pinball machines? What more do you want? Whack-a-mole?

d7Z3GJN1miaoO0I4JLRMWQ.text: Unable to order from the restaurant as they don't answer their phone. Waited on hold for almost 10 minutes without anyone answering. This isn't a good business practice if you want to stay open.

jFj_YcFIUviOfHM6G7xVJg.text: I love this place! I have a milk allergy but would rather not be forced to eat exclusively vegan food, so after discovering that there is a pizza shop a few blocks from my house that serves vegan cheese with non-vegan toppings I had to try it. Their pizzas are priced by size, and you are free to choose whatever toppings you want at an extra charge. I felt the prices were extremely reasonable compared to some of the specialty vegan or allergy-free pizzerias in Pittsburgh. The pizza itself was amazing. It was piping hot and ready exactly when they said it would be, which is a huge plus in my book. I can't wait to become a regular here!

dO49XfCb7v_lolgu7k84Ag.text: Was really excited to try this place because it seemed so highly rated. Went last night with my boyfriend. We ordered cheesy breadsticks and a large margarita pizza. We showed up about 30 minutes after the order, as they told us to, and ended up waiting almost an additional 15 minutes--which happens so no big deal. I'm giving it two stars because we really liked the breadsticks and the cheese on the pizza was great. However, the pizza was raw. The wax paper in the box had somehow melted into the pizza making it impossible to remove and parts of the pizza completely inedible. It tasted like we were eating a pizza that hadn't even been put in the oven yet. Really disappointed in this place, especially considering we could have gone to one of the ACTUAL good places around here like fioris or mineos and gotten more food for less money. Pretty mad we had to pay for food that was raw. It seems that they rushed to complete our order once we showed up to get the pizza. Had they just explained that they forgot and had us wait a little longer for a cooked pizza, we wouldn't have been upset at all. We won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pictures of our raw pizza

fvMdTAklvuuLruzRLREstw.text: Normally Yelp is accurate on rankings for the most part, but I think this place is way overrated.  I ordered a XL pepperoni for pickup and made my way to the location, it's a pretty cool shop in a up and coming part of town.  My first impression walking in was that everyone seemed friendly and working hard.  This place seemed to be doing very good business (probably because it is so cheap), but the first thing I noticed was a pungent oder of BO wafting through the air.  Now I'll admit it was a hot day, but it made me think twice about the cleanliness of the people making my pizza.  Regardless, I picked up my pizza and rolled out.    As I was making my way home, I took a look at the pie and was not that impressed as it looked super oily and blah.  I hoped it tasted better than it looked and while I'm no expert, I know a good pizza when I taste one and couldn't wait to try it.  Unfortunately, the look of the pizza mirrored the taste (as in not impressive).  It was very bland and nothing special.  After seeing all these great reviews maybe it was just my experience that wasn't up to par.  I'm no hater on places just to hate, but I'm honest and don't think this place was that great.    I really wanted to like this place, but I'll never eat here again.

lnSxSjkwOE8GESHE4v6Zow.text: Great Unique Pizza, with a ton of vegan friendly options.  Wished we stayed a bit longer, would have loved to try the vegan hoagie.

AxW1gduy56-3N0uhQrO9DA.text: Food is great especially if you want some vegetarian meat substitutes. Lose of a star because their answering service is seriously awful, anytime I try to call and order it I get frustrated and hang up after 20 minutes of waiting and end up having to drive over, order, wait, and take it home. A real waste of customer time.

Mg1-qxZYY2-8E0lpqOi48w.text: As a vegan, this is a place in Pittsburgh that I have heard people rave about. It's always fun to be able to order (almost) anything. I had the seitan melt, one of their most popular sandwiches, and it was delicious. It was also super cheap - around $5 for the 6" sub, which is so packed with seitan and veggies that it was more than enough. It was very yummy, and the vibe of the restaurant was very punk and cool. It is right across the street from a music venue, so that crowd stops in often.

photos.caption: Photo of Spak Brothers Pizza and More - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-mQFi_DJQP2lIT_l3cCBew.text: Vegetarian friendly menu that does not disappoint!  We are visiting Pittsburgh and decided to give Spak Bros. a try based on its many vegetarian options.  I am so glad that we did - the Seitan Melt BBQ style was one of the best vegetarian sandwiches I've ever had anywhere.  The Seitan wings were also very good and my daughter loved her cheese hoagie (not on the menu - but they gladly accommodated her wishes).  We also had very good customer service.  Thanks for a great lunch, Spak!

yW2vbw9_C0HeGdTVXHajlg.text: I got a few slices of pizza and some wings. The pizza was pretty decent, I'd be happy eating it any time. Ordering the wings was confusing because they switched them up or something. I ordered ten but got a lot more, enough that I almost couldn't finish them. They were crispy and cooked well and the hot sauce was okay but nothing really that exciting. The problem I had with the wings was that there were a lot of broken ones or fragments. Looking back I wish I had tried some of the vegan options that everyone else raves about. Overall though it was a pretty good experience.

q3O-IFFK4hJ4-4XE-FDWxA.text: I love. love. Spak.  The only reason why I'm not obese and broke is because Spak doesn't deliver or else I'd order their food. every. day.  I love their sandwiches and sweet potato fries. I don't think I ordered anything that I didn't like here. Couldn't go wrong with Spak.  The food is pretty fast and the staff there is friendly enough as well.

AubornYnsgKq6M5UxR8SKw.text: Full disclosure. I don't think Spak is bad at all. It is good food. Nothing to rave over, but solid.  However, the customer service is just atrocious. I won't go into the all details, because honestly nobody cares. But during an order with a very rude and agitated employee, I asked for an Italian sandwich, instead of informing me politely like a reasonable human being that they did not have that sandwich today, the gentleman on the phone repeatedly screamed "no! No! No!" At me to inform me that I could not have that sandwich. Being nice was difficult, but I obviously chose not to order anything from Spak that day and definitely won't again.  I know they have an image. They are all very cool people, but have massive chips on their shoulders. It would just be nice to see a little humility and maybe to have a reasonable conversation with management/ownership, because these actions towards customers are not few and far between.

AualMBH_XrBbmxc1Zfj2HA.text: I love Pizza, so I decided to try this place because it was clear that plenty are a fan. I am now one myself between the pizza and the sandwich it is definitely enough to bring me back, driving past it was a bit questionable to the eye because it does appear a bit run down, but as they say do not judge a book by its cover because this is definitely a gem and worth every bite!

b2PXc3GZp1rdW-fLdmMSiA.text: You don't get Spak pizza. Spak Pizza gets you.  It's punk rock pizza, that will kick mainstream pizza's butt. It's edgy, tasty and sexy.  The fact that they use Parma brand meats on their hoagies shoots them to the stratosphere of taste. The pizza, with a bunch of toppings and a tasty sauce will have you jonesing after you finish.  To top it off they have vegan items that are just as delicious.  Making PIttsburgh proud with their pizza and sammiches.
